title: R-Ladies Singapore: Kick Off Session!
description:
üë©‚Äçüíª‚ú® Welcome to our first **R-Ladies Session**! We‚Äôre thrilled to have you join us for this journey into the world of R and data analysis.
**Who We Are**
R-Ladies is a global organization that promotes gender diversity in the R community, providing an inclusive, supportive space for women and gender minorities interested in data science, programming, and data-driven storytelling. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned R user or just curious, you‚Äôre in the right place!
**What We‚Äôll Cover Today**
We'll start with a quick intro to R, covering the basics so that you feel comfortable working in the environment. Then, we‚Äôll dip our toes into **dplyr**, one of the most popular packages in R for data manipulation, using the classic `iris` dataset. Don‚Äôt worry if this is all new; by the end of today‚Äôs session, you'll have a toolkit to start exploring data with confidence.
**Session Outline**

1. **Introduction to R**: Setting up, basic commands, and understanding the console.
2. **The `iris` Dataset**: A quick look at our data, and why this is such a popular dataset for learning.
3. **Introduction to `dplyr`**: Learn how to filter, select, arrange, and summarize data using simple, readable code.

**What to Expect**
This session will be interactive! Feel free to ask questions, share your screen, and explore along with us. R is as much about experimentation as it is about coding‚Äîdon‚Äôt be afraid to make mistakes.
Let‚Äôs dive in and have some fun! üåà

title: R en Red: ARcenso, Oportunidades y Comunidad
description:
**¬°R-Ladies Buenos Aires junto a R en Buenos Aires te invitan a su √∫ltima actividad del a√±o!** Cerramos el a√±o celebrando lo logrado en comunidad con dos paneles espectaculares:

* **ARcenso:** [Andrea Gomez Vargas](https://soyandrea.netlify.app/) y Emanuel Ciardullo nos estar√°n presentando avances y primeros pasos en su experiencia desarrollando el paquete [ARcenso](https://soyandrea.github.io/arcenso/) para la gesti√≥n de datos de los censos nacionales de poblaci√≥n como parte del programa de campeones y campeonas del software de rOpenSci.
* **Oportunidades y Comunidad:** [Mar√≠a Nanton](https://rladiesba.netlify.app/author/maria-nanton/), [Jesica Formoso](https://rladiesba.netlify.app/author/jesica-formoso/) y [Betsy Cohen](https://rladiesba.netlify.app/author/betsabe-cohen/) de R-Ladies BA nos van a presentar diferentes experiencias y oportunidades de becas, conferencias y experiencias de trabajo dentro de la comunidad de R a nivel local como internacional.

title: EOY In-Person R-Ladies Meetup: Share, Learn, and Connect!
description:
Join us for our final R-Ladies event of the year! This in-person gathering is a fantastic opportunity to:

* Practice presenting your R-focused projects or work in a supportive environment.
* Gain valuable insights and feedback from a diverse group of peers.
* Network and celebrate the year with fellow R enthusiasts over dinner.

**Why present your work?**
Use this as your safe and welcoming space to hone your skills and learn from others. This is a great way to:
‚Ä¢ **Increase your visibility** in the R community and showcase your work.
‚Ä¢ **Enhance your public speaking skills** in a friendly and constructive setting.
‚Ä¢ **Build confidence** in sharing your ideas and discussing your methods.
‚Ä¢ Receive **constructive feedback** to refine your project or communication.
‚Ä¢ Connect with like-minded individuals who share your interests in R programming.

After the presentations, we‚Äôll head to King Street for a relaxed dinner and networking.

**How to Participate**:

1. **Present your work**: If you‚Äôd like to present, please let us know by answering our questions!
2. **Attend the event**: RSVP to secure your spot.

**Cost**:
Free to attend the event; dinner will be at your own expense.

See you there!

***R-Ladies Sydney organisers***

***Thank you Nous Group for supporting the RLadies!***
*Find us on X @rladiessydney and on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/14405806/) for more information on news, presentations and code!*

By taking part in an R-Ladies Sydney event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community‚Äôs aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.\*
***Code of Conduct***\*: R-Ladies Sydney is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*
***Community Policies***\*: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Sydney events to be of minority genders.\*

title: Lunch & Learn: An Introduction to Survival Analysis in R
description: This talk will provide a general introduction to survival analysis in R. After introducing the concept of and need for survival analysis methods, we will first discuss how to format a dataset properly to conduct a survival analysis, including working with dates, calculating date differences, and coding events and censoring. Then, we will learn how to perform basic survival analyses in R including plotting Kaplan-Meier curves and fitting Cox regression models. We will discuss the proper ways to interpret the results, and some of the common ways survival analysis results are mis-interpreted.

title: Graficando con R base
description:
**Detalles**

Alguna vez has querido mejorar el dise√±o de tus graficos unicamente con las paqueterias base de R?

Cuando queremos hacer un grafico para presumirlo en nuestra tesis y articulos lo primero que pensamos es en el sin fin de herramientas que nos brinda la libreria ggplot2. Sin embargo, cuando uno empieza a dar sus primeros pasos en R, los graficos base de R proporcionan una variedad de funciones que facilitan y resaltan el dise√±o de graficos coloridos y ordenados. Adem√°s una vez comprendido el uso de algunas funciones de graficos R base facilita el uso de otras librerias con mayor numero de funciones para el dise√±o de graficos.

La finalidad de este meetup es realizar cuatro tipos de graficos con R base y explorar algunas funciones basicas para mejorar el dise√±o de nuestros gr√°ficos. R base maneja una variedad de graficos por lo que para este taller se explicar√° brevemente como hacer graficos de barra, histogramas, cajas de bigote y regresiones lineales.

**Imparte**
Katia Hern√°ndez Bola√±os
Mar√≠a Jos√© Mondrag√≥n

**Requerimientos**

Tener instalado R >= 4.0
Tener instalado RStudio >= 1.4
Tener git instalado

title: Using GitHub Copilot (and others LLM) with R
description:
Join us for an exciting and insightful session with **Yanina Bellini Saibene**, as she explores the integration of **GitHub Copilot** (and other **Large Language Models**, LLMs) with **R**!

**In her own words**:
*‚ÄúIn this talk, I will demonstrate how to use GitHub Copilot within RStudio to code with R. I will also show other large language models (LLMs) and showcase examples of wrangling data and developing R packages. I will also highlight both opportunities and challenges when integrating LLMs into an educational context.‚Äù*

The integration of **LLMs** offers both **exciting opportunities** and **complex challenges**, especially within an **educational setting**. Yanina will share her insights into how these technologies can **enhance productivity** and **support learning**, while also discussing the potential risks and considerations when using AI in education.

This session is perfect for anyone curious about how AI-powered tools like GitHub Copilot can **enhance** your R programming experience, whether you‚Äôre a beginner or an advanced R user. üöÄ

**Why You Should Attend**:
‚Ä¢ **Hands-on demonstration** of how to use GitHub Copilot with RStudio.
‚Ä¢ Learn how LLMs can assist with **data wrangling** and **R package development**.
‚Ä¢ Discuss the **benefits and challenges** of integrating LLMs into the **educational space**.
‚Ä¢ Explore ways to **optimize your workflow** and speed up coding tasks with AI support.

This event promises to be both **informative** and **thought-provoking**, and we are excited to have you join us for this session. Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity to explore the future of coding with R and AI!

title: Construindo seu primeiro dashboard interativo com o {Shiny}
description: O Shiny √© um framework para criar aplicativos web de maneira f√°cil usando c√≥digo R, sem precisar de qualquer conhecimento de HTML, CSS ou JavaScript. Por outro lado, o Shiny possui componentes de interface de usu√°rio que podem ser facilmente personalizadas ou estendidas, e seu servidor usa programa√ß√£o reativa para permitir que voc√™ crie qualquer tipo de l√≥gica de back-end que desejar. Atualmente, o Shiny √© usado em quase tantos nichos e ind√∫strias quanto o pr√≥prio R. Na academia √© usado como um meio chamativo para exibir novos resultados, m√©todos ou modelos estat√≠sticos e em empresas para configurar pain√©is de m√©tricas em tempo real que incorporam an√°lises avan√ßadas. Este minicurso foi projetado para lev√°-lo de n√£o saber nada sobre Shiny para ser capaz de construir dashboards, onde voc√™ ser√° capaz de expor seus resultados de maneira interativa que ainda s√£o f√°ceis de manter e de alto desempenho.

title: R-ladies New York End of Year Social
description:
Happy Holidays! Come celebrate how far R-Ladies New York has come this year at this fun, end-of-the-year social at the Other Half Brewing. This event will be in-person, and a great gathering to close out our year!

We want to thank you all for your incredible support and for being part of the R-Ladies community. We hope to see you there!

Drinks will be available for purchase. Dress in casual or holiday gear - we welcome it all!

title: R in Research
description: R is a free, open-source statistical programming language used extensively in research and this talk discusses multiple publications of this type. The first relates to sonification of NASA data, the second is simulations necessary when undertaking innovative designs, and the last is a graphical user interface used by researchers to assure balance in cluster randomized trials.

**Programa√ß√£o:**

**Shiny para emerg√™ncias: um modelo de gest√£o de doa√ß√µes e recursos em emerg√™ncias clim√°ticas**
Resumo: Nos primeiros dias das enchentes de maio de 2024, uma for√ßa-tarefa formada por volunt√°rios da comunidade PUCRS foi criada para gerenciar as doa√ß√µes recebidas. Esse esfor√ßo resultou na cria√ß√£o de um dashboard no Power BI. Contudo, devido √† natureza paga do software, seu uso de forma expandida foi limitado. Para viabilizar o acesso a mais usu√°rios e como forma de retribui√ß√£o √† comunidade, desenvolveu-se um aplicativo no Shiny, que em breve estar√° dispon√≠vel para que outras institui√ß√µes ou grupos possam adotar o modelo de gest√£o de doa√ß√µes, acompanhamento de recursos e outras funcionalidades.

**R e Spark: uma introdu√ß√£o ao sparklyr**

Conhecer ferramentas que auxiliam neste processo √© essencial para tornar o trabalho mais f√°cil. Nesta introdu√ß√£o, conheceremos o funcionamento do Spark, as particularidades do seu uso, e algumas de suas limita√ß√µes.

*Bruna Dalmoro* \- Cientista de Dados no Sicredi\, bacharela em Estat√≠stica pela UFRGS\, mestra em Ci√™ncia da Computa√ß√£o pela PUCRS\.

title: End of Year Networking Event 2024 - In-person Only!
description:
Please join us on Thursday 05th December 2024 on the **rooftop** at The Clyde Hotel in Carlton from 5.30pm. This is a networking catch-up with some light refreshments and will only be **in-person**. Please register your attendance on Meetup by the 1st December for planning purposes.

title: R-Ladies Book Club: Happy Git and GitHub for the useR (Third meeting)

**Why:** For this book club we - the Bergen, Den Bosch and Amsterdam chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. In each meeting, we will work through a chapter(s) of the book together. title: Transforma tus datos en historias visuales con Quarto
description:
**¬°Aviso IMPORTANTE!**

Por cuestiones ajenas a RLadies Buenos Aires, **EL MEETUP SE REALIZARA DE MANERA ON LINE.**
Estaremos enviando el enlace a Zoom a todas las personas inscriptas a la brevedad.

\-\-\-
**Acerca de este Meetup**

En esta oportunidad, **Jesica Formoso** nos introducir√° a **[Quarto](https://quarto.org/)**, un sistema de publicaci√≥n de c√≥digo abierto dise√±ado para crear documentos cient√≠ficos y t√©cnicos de manera din√°mica y reproducible.
Aprenderemos c√≥mo Quarto expande las capacidades de R Markdown, permiti√©ndonos generar informes, presentaciones y sitios web. A lo largo del taller, exploraremos ejemplos pr√°cticos de su uso en informes reproducibles, abordando temas como la integraci√≥n de c√≥digo y texto, la personalizaci√≥n de formatos de salida y el uso de par√°metros para crear variantes de documentos.
Este taller es **introductorio** est√° dirigida a personas con un **conocimiento b√°sico de R** y **poca o ninguna experiencia previa con Quarto**.
**Requerimientos:**

* R: 4.4.1
* Quarto: v1.5 (descargar quarto CLI [aqu√≠](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/))
* RStudio: 2024.04.2+764 (descargar [aqu√≠](https://posit.co/downloads/))
* Instalar el paquete **tidyverse**.

Para poder seguir el taller sin inconvenientes, te pedimos que traigas tu computadora preparada, con R y RStudio actualizados, y el quarto CLI y el paquete tidyverse instalados.

Finalmente, te invitamos a compartir el link al meetup para quien quiera inscribirse.
**¬°Te esperamos!**

title: Visualizing Data with R: An R-Ladies Introduction
description:
Join us for the R-Ladies New Delhi Chapter Meetup! This session is designed to introduce new members and attendees to the R programming language and the mission of R-Ladies, a global organization promoting gender diversity in the R community.
The event will feature:

1. **Introduction to R-Ladies and R Programming:** Learn about the community and how R can empower your data analysis skills.
2. **Hands-on Workshop:** Dive into data visualization using popular R libraries.

**What to Bring:**

title: Leveraging the Power of Data in Sport
description:
R Ladies Melbourne is very excited to announce our next meetup event. We will be welcoming two data analytics experts, Elisa Koch and Lauren Boothby, who both work at the Australian Football League and will be joining us to discuss *Leveraging the Power of Data in Sport.*

Elisa has worked as a Data & Analytics leader in the US and Australia in industries spanning finance, FMCG, technology, and sport. Currently, she is the Head of Data and Analytics at the Australian Football League (AFL). She is passionate about leading businesses to be more data driven at all levels of the business. Elisa is a people-first leader passionate about building high-performing teams built on diverse thinking and the ability to bring our authentic selves to work. Elisa serves as an Advisory Board Member for the Institute of Analytic Professionals Australia and is on the board of Spectrum Migrant Resource Centre, a non-profit focused on enabling people with migrant and refugee backgrounds to feel at home in Australia.

Lauren is a Senior Data Analyst and joined the Data and Analytics team at the AFL in 2023 from North Melbourne where she spent over five years working in both the football department and strategy team as a data analyst. Previous to this, Lauren has experience working with the West Coast Fever Netball Team and the West Coast Eagles Football Club.

Please join us on Wednesday 20th November 2024 at Dius Offices Melbourne from 5.30pm. We will first have a casual networking catch-up with some light refreshments, and the presentation will start at 6pm. You will also be able to join this event online if you are not able to join us in person. Please register your attendance (both in-person and online) on Meetup by the 14th November for planning purposes.

We look forward to seeing you there!

R Ladies Melbourne

title: R-Ladies Boook club: Happy Git and GitHub for the useR (Second meeting)
description:
Join us for the second meeting of the online book club discussing **‚Äò[Happy Git and Github for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/)**‚Äô by Jenny Bryan.
**When:** Tuesday November 19 @ 17:00 CET (11:00 ET)
**Where:** [Zoom](https://us02web.zoom.us/j/87240540921?pwd=E4Lm8qap1SGhIWgakNCVtyjjcs95b6.1)
**What:** We will discuss the parts *Installation* and *Connect Git, GitHub, RStudio* of the [book](https://happygitwithr.com/).
Book club materials can be found on our [Github](https://github.com/rladiesboookclub/happygitwithr). The Github also has a discussions page where participants can ask questions or discuss different aspects of the book as they move through it. For help using GitHub discussions see [here](https://docs.github.com/en/discussions/quickstart).
**Who:** Our presenter will be co-host **Sehee Rim** from [R-Ladies Bergen](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-bergen/).
**Why:** For this book club we - the Bergen, Den Bosch and Amsterdam chapters of R Ladies - are joining forces. We will meet every two weeks, and in each meeting, we will work through a different chapter of the book together. We are doing this boook club (spelling intentional), because we like to learn together. It is not the case presenters are necessarily the experts on the matter. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns presenting chapters. If you‚Äôre not comfortable presenting, just listening is also okay.
If you cannot make it this time, feel free to join in on one of the subsequent meetings.
R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/).
*As always, everyone, regardless of gender identity, is welcome to join our events!*
**Cross-posting:** This event is cross posted on the [R-Ladies Den Bosch](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-den-bosch/events/304441935) and [R-Ladies Amsterdam](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-amsterdam/events/304454190/?utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=share-btn_savedevents_share_modal&utm_source=link) meet-up pages.

title: Openscapes: Forking as a Worldview
description:
**Forking as a Worldview: Scaling Solutions in Open Science with Environmental and Earth Science**

Join us for an enlightening session with **[Julia Stewart Lowndes](https://www.linkedin.com/in/julia-stewart-lowndes/)**, the Director of **[Openscapes](https://openscapes.org/)**, as she delves into the transformative concept of ‚Äúforking‚Äù in the realm of open science. Originally rooted in software development, forking has evolved into a powerful approach for addressing collaborative challenges across government and academia.

Julia will share her insights on how forking goes beyond mere code adaptation; it embodies a mindset that promotes innovation, credit-sharing, and collective progress. Through her work with Openscapes and NASA, Julia has built communities that empower teams to transition their workflows to the cloud and beyond.

In her own words:

‚Äú*Forking is a concept from software development that has evolved with open source software and the internet. It means taking something that works and is made available, then adapting it for your own use while staying connected to the source. This networking allows for contributions back to the original work and ensures proper credit is given. While forking traditionally involves code, it can apply to virtually anything‚Äîit‚Äôs about taking what works to new places to solve problems more efficiently.*

*Since 2018, Openscapes has partnered with teams in government and academia to help them tackle significant collaborative challenges through open science. One of our primary focuses at NASA Openscapes has been upskilling users of NASA Earthdata as they transition their workflows to cloud computing.*

*We‚Äôve fostered a mentor community across NASA Earth science data centers (DAACs) to co-create tutorials and develop teaching, mentoring, and facilitation skills. Along the way, we‚Äôve forked numerous resources, including code, documentation, workshop materials, presentations, and even entire programs like NOAA Fisheries Openscapes and Pathways to Open Science.*

*Ultimately, we‚Äôve discovered that forking represents a way of thinking‚Äîa worldview. Recognizing forking as an essential element of our collaborative innovation efforts in open science is crucial, and I am eager to discuss it with all of you!*‚Äù

**Don‚Äôt miss this unique opportunity to learn from Julia Stewart Lowndes, a thought leader in open science. Whether you‚Äôre interested in cloud-based workflows, open data, or fostering innovation through collaboration, this talk is sure to provide valuable insights and inspiration.**

title: R-Ladies NYC November Book Club!
description:
R-Ladies NYC will be hosting a book club in November! We will be reading **Atlas of AI: Power, Politics, and the Planetary Costs of Artificial Intelligence by Kate Crawford**. title: Visualising data with ggplot2 ‚Äì Preparing figures for publication and outreach
description:
The visualisations we use to present our findings matter as much as the text, if not more. We will walk through the steps to create beautiful figures that can make posters, talks, and publications shine. If you can picture a cool way to visualize data, it can probably be achieved with ggplot2!

This workshop is presented by Ryssa. She is a postdoc in Social Brain Sciences at ETH Zurich. Her research focuses on how the brain and body mediate the development of intergenerational social bonds, and how this can reduce loneliness for people of all ages.

**Programm:**
18:30-20:15 workshop
20:15 - onwards socializing and drinks

**Location:**
University of Zurich (KOL-H-309)

We are looking forward to having a great evening together!

Seraphina, C√©line, Luisa, Elena and Ryssa!

title: Centralized database management with AWS and R/Shiny
description:
Join us for our next meetup in November, to hear from **Ilaria Capelli** and **Mina Sohrabi** about their work at Raiffeisen Bank International. We will explore how their new R package simplifies querying their centralized database through a secure **AWS** setup and discover their intuitive **R/Shiny** interface for easy data access and updates. They will showcase features like Excel-like operations via **rhandsontable**, designed to enhance usability for both technical and non-technical users. Perfect for analysts and clients looking to smoothly interact with macroeconomic data!

**Abstract**:
As developers at a leading economic and financial markets research institution, centralizing our data is crucial for both internal (backtesting, sharing forecasts, model validations) and external (client access) use cases. Our contribution consists of two parts: first, the introduction of our R package, developed using the ‚ÄúOpen API generator,‚Äù enabling seamless querying of our database via a RESTful API. Additionally, we show the integration of a robust authorization and authentication layer within AWS cloud infrastructure. Second, we have designed a user-friendly R/Shiny-based frontend to facilitate easy access for non-technical users. This interface displays forecasts and historic data for various variables and countries, allowing for data updates and downloads. To mimic familiar Excel operations such as row-wise pasting and data removal, we have successfully utilized the open-source R-wrapper rhandsontable of the JavaScript library handsontable. Both contributions enable our analysts and clients to smoothly interact with our database by providing a convenient, secure, and user-friendly environment, enhancing the accessibility of our macroeconomic data for all stakeholders.

title: Tips and Tricks! (POSTPONED to Wednesday 11/13)
description:
**UPDATE 11/6, 3:15pm PST**

To our R-Ladies community --

While we were very much looking forward to sharing community-curated R tips & tricks with you all tonight, we have decided to postpone this event to **next Wednesday 11/13 (6:00pm PST/4:00pm HST).**

We are processing and grieving the outcome of this election, and recognize that many of our fellow R-Ladies are navigating complex emotions as well. We are so grateful for this community, and the support that each of our members brings to our events. We are looking forward to connecting and learning with you all next week.

Thank you for understanding, and please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out if you need support or want to connect.

\-\-\-

Hello, R-Ladies Santa Barbara!

Do you have a tip, trick, or shortcut that makes your R experience better? We want to hear all about it! If you've been with us for a while, you might remember our successful "R Tips and Tricks" event a few years ago. We loved it, and learned so many helpful tidbits that we want to do it again - but this time, as a **collaboration with R-Ladies Honolulu!** Join us for a virtual meetup on **Wednesday, November 6 from 6-7:30 PT.**

**To make this event happen, we need your help! Please submit your tip or trick using this [form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11LELy3CqWj8cB8zDS-OLH4o1oRWb8__k7tgo9vI4O6c/edit?ts=66edadda), and we'll put together a slide.** During the event, you have the option to take a minute or two to present your slide, OR one of the R-Ladies co-organizers can present the slide if you prefer. Check out the [slide deck](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/13ff2h-9JEd-ziRua8i5Akaypp0br8BOUXQzO6KtaZA8/edit#slide=id.g77e18ccd7e_0_0) from our last Tips and Tricks event for inspiration - tips can range from R packages, functions, or shortcuts to handy workflow tools that may not be R-specific.

**We will send out Zoom information to all registered attendees closer to the event.**
We hope to see you in November to hear about all the tips and tricks used by R-Ladies in Santa Barbara and Honolulu. Who knows - you might learn something new that you won't be able to code without!

Danielle, Camila, and Sam

description: In this session, we'll take an Excel default-style chart and transform it into a visually engaging and impactful plot using R. title: Holiday special | Presenting your work to non-scientists
description:
We bring you a holiday special in collaboration with Project Bridge -- *how do you present your work to non-scientists over holiday dinners?*

The workshop will focus on communicating research with general audiences!

**MATERIALS**
[https://github.com/rladies-aurora/202411-scicomm](https://github.com/rladies-aurora/202411-scicomm)

**ZOOM LINK**
[https://ucdenver.zoom.us/j/93885644391?pwd=mFQcWKrnSkWqsOkeJGtJG8K7HfaGW0.1](https://ucdenver.zoom.us/j/93885644391?pwd=mFQcWKrnSkWqsOkeJGtJG8K7HfaGW0.1)

**SPONSOR**
Project Bridge Colorado

**More info:** The goal of the [Project Bridge](https://www.cuanschutz.edu/services/project-bridge) organization is to bridge the communication gap between scientists and their communities by creating and supporting opportunities to foster public interest in scientific research. This collaborative workshop, hosted by R Ladies and Project Bridge Colorado, will offer valuable tips and tricks for communicating science to non-scientific audiences. Many scientists struggle to explain their work without relying on technical jargon, as it often feels like a second language. In this workshop, we will explore effective strategies to present complex research in a way that resonates with the general public.

title: Introduction to Positron
description:
Join us for an interactive demo / overview of Positron, the new "polyglot" data science IDE from Posit, the makers of RStudio. This walkthrough will include coverage of relative benefits and drawbacks compared to RStudio, with an emphasis on how Positron might bring new customizability and convenience to your R data workflows. (Please note that Positron is still very firmly in beta! This talk is intended to introduce and enable confident exploration of this nascent IDE.)

Link will be provided closer to the event.

Want to learn more about Positron, check out these resources.

1\. https://www\.appsilon\.com/post/introducing\-positron
2\. https://drmowinckels\.io/blog/2024/positron/
3\. https://www\.andrewheiss\.com/blog/2024/07/08/fun\-with\-positron/
4\. https://github\.com/posit\-dev/positron/wiki\#is\-positron\-for\-me
5\. https://positron\.posit\.co/
6\. https://www\.superdatascience\.com/podcast/817
7\. https://www\.youtube\.com/watch?v=8uRcB34Hhsw

title: Make your analysis shine with {gtsummary}
description:
Today, our RLadies Sydney co-organiser *Kristy* will tell us everything she knows about the gtsummary R package!

The ***{gtsummary}*** package provides an **elegant and flexible way to create publication-ready analytical and summary tables** using the **R** programming language. The {gtsummary} package summarizes data sets, regression models, and more, using sensible defaults with highly customizable capabilities.

We look forward to seeing you online or in-person :)

title: Book club: Happy Git and GitHub for the useR - kick-off session
description:
Interested in streamlining your workflow by connecting Git and R? Join our **book club** for ‚Äú**[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/)‚Äù** by Jennifer (Jenny) Bryan! The book describes the use of the version control system Git and the hosting site GitHub for statistical and data scientific workflows in R.

After our engaging sessions on ‚ÄúBuilding Reproducible Analytical Pipelines with R‚Äù by R-Ladies Bergen and ‚ÄúHands-On Machine Learning with R‚Äù by R-Ladies Den Bosch, we're excited to team up for a joint book club, together with R-Ladies Amsterdam!

Jenny Bryan herself will introduce the book and be available for questions during the kick-off session!

**When**: Kicking off on Wednesday, November 6, 2024, at 16:30 CET (Den Bosch/Bergen/Amsterdam time) ‚Äì thereafter 17.00 CET every 2 weeks
**Where**: Zoom (link available for attendees)
**What to expect?**

* Book Club Format: Every two weeks, we‚Äôll work through each chapter together. To make this a group effort, the idea is that all participants take turns in presenting chapters. Participants are encouraged to present chapter summaries, but listening in is equally welcome.
* Presentations summarizing key points from each chapter
* Open discussions for questions, insights, and collaborative learning

Feel free to join us at any session, even if you miss the first one. We‚Äôll explore ‚Äú**[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/)‚Äù** together ‚Äì learning is better in good company! You do not have to prepare anything for the kick-off session.

**Code of Conduct**
R-Ladies is committed to a welcoming, harassment-free experience for everyone. We have a strict Code of Conduct and do not tolerate harassment in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/)

**Cross Posting**
This event will be cross posted on the [R-Ladies Den Bosch](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-den-bosch/events/304310072) and [R-Ladies Amsterdam](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-amsterdam/events/304310352/) meet-up pages.

title: Let me GitHub Search that for you
description:
There's an amazing amount of R code on GitHub, including the source of all CRAN packages and the source of R itself. As a result, lots of intermediate-to-advanced questions about R programming can be at least partially answered via an appropriate code search on GitHub. I must do this multiple times per day and I am sure that I am not alone. I'll share some tips on how GitHub code search can be a very effective technique for self-help for an R programmer.

Yes, this event will be recorded and posted on the R-Ladies Philly YouTube channel.

title: Open Source Software and The Government
description:
üîî **Important Update for Our Attendees!** üîî

The event will be at 6:30pm CET / 1:30pm EDT
\-\-\-\-

Are you interested in how open source software can transform government operations? Join us for an insightful event featuring **Dr. Gwynn Gebeyehu**, who will explore the pivotal role of open source solutions in the public sector.

In her own words:
*‚ÄúOpen-source software (OSS) is a critical part of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and big data. However, it comes with **ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY**, which poses challenges for risk-averse governments. Additionally, historical procurement practices related to acquisition, evaluation, and lobbying complicate matters. This talk discusses one approach to centering OSS within governmental institutions.‚Äù*

From enhancing transparency to fostering innovation, open source technology has the potential to reshape public service as we know it. This is a unique opportunity to discover how technology can positively impact the public sector. **Don‚Äôt miss out‚Äîreserve your spot now and prepare for an inspiring session!**

title: Random projection for regression analysis in R
description:
We hope you have all had a great summer, and are now ready to meet fellow R-Ladies and learn new things again! For our first event after the summer we will welcome our own **Laura Vana-G√ºr** who will talk about how we can use random projection for regression analysis in R using the SPAR package (https://github.com/RomanParzer/SPAR).

**Abstract**:
Random projection is a powerful and important tool for dimensionality reduction where a set of high-dimensional points is linearly mapped onto a lower dimension. Random projection matrices can be rapidly generated and are oblivious to the data distribution, maintain interpretability and are equipped with theoretical guarantees on preserving the geometry of the original space with a high probability. When employed in a supervised setting, they can provide a significant reduction in computational cost. However, they tend to overfit so it is desirable to first eliminate the unimportant predictors and then perform the random projection and estimate the model on the space of the reduced (i.e., projected) predictors. Moreover, to reduce the uncertainty from the random projection, ensembles can be built. In this work we propose an R package which implements a variety of random projection and screening tools for regression in high-dimensional settings. The functionality of the package is presented using simulated and real data examples.

title: R Package Development
description:
WHAT TO EXPECT
This workshop will provide a practical introductory overview (with hands-on practice) with R package development.

**WHO is this for?**

* If you'd like to highly automate common tasks and share it with other R users
* If you're interested in contributing your work and making it available on the Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN)

**TOPICS**

* Learn the structure of R package and its components
* Build your own R package using RStudio
* Enhance your R package with well-organized documentation (such as Vignettes, GitHub)

**SET-UP**
To benefit most from this workshop, please bring your laptop with pre-installed RStudio ([https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rstudio.com%2Fproducts%2Frstudio%2F&data=05%7C02%7CKEWALIN.SAMART%40CUANSCHUTZ.EDU%7C954ada6fb6964c5d83d308dcd340115c%7C563337caa517421aaae01aa5b414fd7f%7C0%7C0%7C638617519334802918%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=YQHBFzIs2Bjfm3yeR1AF%2B%2BlkJJuOtWN1BCUhTcYVzxQ%3D&reserved=0 "Original URL: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/. title: Descarga y gesti√≥n de datos del Sistema Meteorol√≥gico Nacional

title: Descarga y gesti√≥n de datos del Sistema Meteorol√≥gico Nacional
description:
## Detalles

Este taller abordar√° el uso de rvest y stringr en R, centrado en la extracci√≥n y manipulaci√≥n de datos textuales. Utilizaremos la p√°gina del Sistema Meteorol√≥gico Nacional para extraer informaci√≥n con rvest y procesarla con stringr, lo que permitir√° a los participantes automatizar la recopilaci√≥n y limpieza de datos web. Al finalizar, los asistentes tendr√°n las herramientas para realizar web scraping y an√°lisis de datos textuales de manera eficiente en R.
**Imparte**
Jessica Daniela Oca√±a Falcon
**Requerimientos**

* Tener instalado R >= 4.0
* Tener instalado RStudio >= 1.4
* Instalar los paquetes rvest y stringr.

title: Welcome to the R-Ladies Sheffield Chapter
description:
Hello! Welcome to the Sheffield Chapter of R-Ladies. We are hosting our first meet up on the 23rd of October to introduce ourselves, talk a bit about the R-Ladies goal and what we'll be doing in this chapter. We will finish with an autumnal Tidy Tuesday activity together so bring your laptops if possible but we can also share.

After the session which we've planned to take an hour, we'll move on to a more relaxed setting at the University Arms where we can just take some time to get to know each other!

In the Hicks Building, we'll be in Lecture Theatre 11. See you then! :)

venues.name: University of Sheffield, Hicks Building, Lecture Theatre 11

title: R-Ladies of HorroR: A Spooky Data Night
description:
**Hello Ghoulish R Ladies of Honolulu!**

**We‚Äôve got not one, but TWO fang-tastically exciting events coming your way! ‚ú®**

**First up, as the fall chills creep in and spooky season takes hold, we‚Äôre conjuring a special Halloween-themed event! For our third gathering, we‚Äôll be working with a horror movie dataset from TidyTuesday‚Äôs archives - guaranteed to send shivers down your spine! Get ready to dive into the eerie world of data, conjuring up spooking visualizations and exploring frightful insights. It‚Äôs a great opportunity to hone your skills by asking questions, exploring the dataset, and casting your ggplot magic to create some hauntingly good graphs! üìäüéÉ**

**Whether you‚Äôre brewing up your first plot or you‚Äôre a seasoned witch casting data spells, ALL levels are welcome! Beginners can learn the basics of data exploration and visualization, while our data wizards can show off their scariest plots. üßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ú®**

**üîÆ RSVP by October 22st - and don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out with any questions!**

**üï∏Ô∏èWhen: October 23rd, 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm HST**
**üï∑Ô∏è Where: Entrepreneur‚Äôs Sandbox**

**But wait, there‚Äôs more!**

**Our second event is a virtual meetup in collaboration with R-Ladies Santa Barbara! üéâ On Wednesday, November 6th, from 4:00-5:30 PM HST, we‚Äôre hosting a Tips & Tricks session where you can share your magical R wisdom! Do you have a clever shortcut, a useful function, or a package that you can‚Äôt code without? We want to hear about it!**

**Help us make this event fun by submitting your tip or trick using our [form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11LELy3CqWj8cB8zDS-OLH4o1oRWb8__k7tgo9vI4O6c/viewform?ts=66edadda&edit_requested=true). During the event, you‚Äôll have the chance to present your slide (just 1-2 minutes), or if you prefer, one of our R-Ladies co-organizers can present for you!**

**üóìÔ∏èWhen: November 6th, 4:00 - 5:30 pm HST**
**üíªWhere: Virtual (Zoom link will be shared with RSVP‚Äôd guests before hand)**

**Need inspiration? Check out the slides from R-Ladies SB‚Äôs last [Tips and Tricks](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/13ff2h-9JEd-ziRua8i5Akaypp0br8BOUXQzO6KtaZA8/edit#slide=id.g77e18ccd7e_0_0) event - anything from R packages and functions to handy workflow tools is fair game!**

**We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you in October and November - whether you‚Äôre creating spooky visuals or brewing up R tips, it‚Äôs going to be fun! Who knows you might just learn something good that you won‚Äôt be able to code without!**

**All the best,**
**Jayslen, Maddie, and Juliette**

title: posit::conf(2024) Watch Party
description:
**2024 Posit Conference Watch Party with R-Ladies Ottawa**

Posit, the company that makes many of the tools you know and love (RStudio, Shiny, the tidyverse, and many more!) hosts an annual conference. This year, the conference took place in Seattle from August 12th-14th. Did you miss the conference, but still want to know what‚Äôs new in the world of data science? Look no further ‚Äì R-Ladies Ottawa is hosting a **posit::conf(2024) Watch Party**!

This event will take place on October 23rd, from 5:30-7:30pm, at the Ottawa Public Library (Sunnyside branch - Program room 1B). Attendance is **FREE** and there will be door prizes available to win (see details below)! We‚Äôll watch a few of the most popular talks from this year‚Äôs conference and have opportunities to discuss and network. Afterwards, we‚Äôll be heading to a restaurant in the Glebe for anyone who would like to join!

**Please note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community.** While our Meetup Group is open to anyone to join, our events are intended to provide a safe space for women and gender minorities. Male allies may attend our in-person events **if they are invited by and accompanied by a woman or gender minority.**

**Door prize giveaway**

By attending this event, you‚Äôll have a chance to win a copy of David Keyes‚Äô new book, R for the Rest of Us: A Statistics-Free Introduction, courtesy of NoStarch Press.

Description of the book: ‚ÄúLearn how to use R for everything from workload automation and creating online reports, to interpreting data, map making, and more.

Written by the founder of a very popular online training platform for the R programming language!

The R programming language is a remarkably powerful tool for data analysis and visualization, but its steep learning curve can be intimidating for some. If you just want to automate repetitive tasks or visualize your data, without the need for complex math, R for the Rest of Us is for you.‚Äù

**Free stickers!**

Posit has generously donated hex stickers for this event! Everyone who attends will be able to take some home.

**Event schedule**

5:30pm - 7:00pm - Watch party and discussion (see talk descriptions below!)
7:00pm - Networking and announcement of door prize winner
7:30pm - We‚Äôll be heading to a restaurant in the Glebe, for anyone who would like to join!

**The talks we‚Äôll watch:**

1\. Introducing Positron \(Julia Silge\) and Exploratory Data Analysis in Python with Positron \(Isabelle Zimmerman\)

Positron is a next generation data science IDE that is newly available to the community for early beta testing. This new IDE is an extensible tool built to facilitate exploratory data analysis, reproducible authoring, and publishing data artifacts. Positron currently supports these data workflows in either or both Python and/or R, and is designed with a forward-looking architecture that can support other data science languages in the future. In this session, learn from the team building Positron about how and why it is designed the way it is, what will feel familiar or new coming from other IDEs, and whether it might be a good fit for your own work.

2\. Closeread: bringing Scrollytelling to Quarto \- Andrew Bray

Scrollytelling is a style of web design that transitions graphics and text as a user scrolls, allowing stories to progress naturally. Despite its power, scrollytelling typically requires specialist web dev skills beyond the reach of many data scientists. Closeread is a Quarto extension that makes a wide range of scrollytelling techniques available to authors without traditional web dev experience, with support for cross-fading plots, graphics and other chunk output alongside narrative content. You can zoom in on poems, prose and images, as well as highlighting important phrases of text. Finally, Closeread allows authors with experience in Observable JS to write their own animated graphics that update smoothly as scrolling progresses.

3\. GitHub: How To Tell Your Professional Story \- Abigail Haddad

GitHub is more than just a version control tool, it's a way of explaining your professional identity to prospective employers and collaborators ‚Äì and you can build your profile now, before you're looking for new opportunities. This talk is about how to think of GitHub as an opportunity, not a chore, and how to represent yourself well without making developing your GitHub profile into a part-time job. I'll talk about why GitHub adds value beyond a personal website, what kinds of projects are helpful to share, and some good development practices to get in the habit of, regardless of your project specifics.

venues.name: Ottawa Public Library - (Sunnyside Branch in The Glebe)

title: Version Control and RStudio
description:
**WORKSHOP OVERVIEW**

Sick of having twenty versions of the same file? Can‚Äôt remember why you changed that line of code? Was it 6 weeks or 2 years ago? Did I add that bit or was it my colleague? In this introductory workshop, we‚Äôll learn about using version control via Git and GitHub, two powerful tools for keeping track of file changes and facilitating collaborative coding.

We‚Äôll also learn how to integrate version control into our RStudio workflow to keep our R code organised! There will be some basic interactive exercises to practice using Git & GitHub (creating a repository; cloning a repository; collaborating using forks). If you‚Äôd like to follow along with the exercises, please make sure to do the below set-up/prep in advance.

**PREPARATION AND RESOURCES**

1. (Install/)Update R and RStudio to the newest versions available to you.
2. If you don‚Äôt already have one, create a free GitHub account at https://github.com

* Register with an academic email if you have one (more perks)
* Think carefully about your username: avoid spaces & uncommon characters; a shorter username is better than longer; usually your real name (or related to it) is best

3. Download GitHub Desktop from https://desktop.github.com
4. Install Git

* It is possible/likely you already have it
* There are thorough instructions for explaining how to check and what to do if you don't have it at: https://happygitwithr.com/install-git.html

**ONLINE PROGRAMME**
The event will be held online and will start at 16:00 (GMT).
Please join us via link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_N2VlOGVhZjktMTMwYi00MDI4LTg1ZTEtZDcwMTNjZmFiM2Ew%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%224ffa3bc4-ecfc-48c0-9080-f5e43ff90e5f%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%2213d75a48-cddd-4e0a-b31a-9aa858d18c90%22%7d

Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Watch Party Francophone pour la posit::conf(2024)
description:
Nous sommes ravis d‚Äôorganiser une #Watch #Party virtuelle pour la conf√©rence organis√©e par Posit qui a eu lieu du 12 au 24 ao√ªt 2024 √† #Seattle üîó ‚Äã‚Äã[https://posit.co/conference/](https://posit.co/conference/).

üéâ Durant cette Watch Party, nous allons regarder les #replays de ces deux pr√©sentations s√©lectionn√©es de la conf√©rence, le lundi 21 octobre 2024 √† partir de 19h00 CEST :

1. **Introducing Positron, a new data science IDE, pr√©sent√© par Julia Silge, Engineering Manager et Tom Mock, Product Manager, Posit, PBC.**
‚ÄúPositron is a next generation data science IDE that is newly available to the community for early beta testing. This new IDE is an extensible tool built to facilitate exploratory data analysis, reproducible authoring, and publishing data artifacts. Positron currently supports these data workflows in either or both Python and/or R, and is designed with a forward-looking architecture that can support other data science languages in the future. In this session, learn from the team building Positron about how and why it is designed the way it is, what will feel familiar or new coming from other IDEs, and whether it might be a good fit for your own work.‚Äù
2. **Quarto, AI, and the Art of Getting Your Life Back, pr√©sent√© par Tyler Morgan-Wall, Research Staff Member, Institute for Defense Analyses.**
‚ÄúTired of endless server issues and maintenance headaches? Want to reclaim your time for coding, writing, and creating? Join me as I share my journey of switching from the server-based headaches of Wordpress to Quarto, with a little help from AI. In this talk, I‚Äôll describe the simple trick I used to convert an existing Wordpress blog‚Äîcomplete with custom scripts, styles, and beautiful 3D dataviz content‚Äîinto a slick Quarto site. I'll then demonstrate some lesser-known features of Quarto to automate deploying a website entirely from a Quarto project file. Finally, I‚Äôll show you how I used AI to customize and style my new Quarto site, and provide several useful strategies to employ if you decide to get some help from AI on your own Quarto journey.‚Äù

title: Transforma tus datos en historias visuales con Quarto
description:
Debido al **paro universitario** que afectara al personal no dicente de la **UNTREF**, hemos decidido suspender la realizaci√≥n del taller planificado para el pr√≥ximo lunes. Acompa√±amos el reclamos en defensa de la universidad p√∫blica üíú

**En breve estaremos comunicando la pr√≥xima fecha.**

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**¬°Se viene un nuevo Meetup PRESENCIAL!**

En esta oportunidad, **Jesica Formoso** nos introducir√° a **[Quarto](https://quarto.org/)**, un sistema de publicaci√≥n de c√≥digo abierto dise√±ado para crear documentos cient√≠ficos y t√©cnicos de manera din√°mica y reproducible.

Aprenderemos c√≥mo Quarto expande las capacidades de R Markdown, permiti√©ndonos generar informes, presentaciones y sitios web. A lo largo del taller, exploraremos ejemplos pr√°cticos de su uso en informes reproducibles, abordando temas como la integraci√≥n de c√≥digo y texto, la personalizaci√≥n de formatos de salida y el uso de par√°metros para crear variantes de documentos.

Este taller es **introductorio** est√° dirigida a personas con un **conocimiento b√°sico de R** y **poca o ninguna experiencia previa con Quarto**.

**Requerimientos:**

* R: 4.4.1
* Quarto: v1.5 (descargar quarto CLI [aqu√≠](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/))
* RStudio: 2024.04.2+764 (descargar [aqu√≠](https://posit.co/downloads/))
* Instalar el paquete **tidyverse**.

Para poder seguir el taller sin inconvenientes, te pedimos que traigas tu computadora preparada, con R y RStudio actualizados, y el quarto CLI y el paquete tidyverse instalados.

Finalmente, te invitamos a compartir el link al meetup para quien quiera inscribirse.

**¬°Te esperamos!**

title: R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks!
description:
We are excited to host an **online** version of one our most popular events - R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks.

***\*\*Update\*\****
We've decided to delay event by 2 weeks to encourage more participants to sign up to give a talk. The new date for the lightning talks is **Sunday, October 20th at 4pm EST**. We hope this extended timeline will allow more members to get involved and contribute. Looking forward to seeing everyone there!

Please fill out the very brief form to submit your 5-minute talk idea! [https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9](https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9)

***What are lightning talks?***
Lighting talks are five minute talks. You can talk about anything R, Python, Tech, and/or Data Science related. Looking for ideas? How about talking about a cool package you found, how you use R/Python in your company, a favorite learning resource, your journey into Data Science, or a side project you've been working on?

Prior lightning talk topics include: 1-Automating Reports with Gmailr; 2-Using Shiny to Avoid Boring Tasks at Work; 3-How to Do VLOOKUP in R; 4-Balancing Business and Technical Requirements; 5-Pie Charts: Friend or Foe?

Interested in proposing a talk but want to brainstorm ideas, get feedback, or some encouragement? We're here to help! You can attend one of our Prep & Brainstorm Workshops, join #lightningtalks channel in our slack channel, or email [nyc@rladies.org](mailto:nyc@rladies.org). We would be happy to set up a time to talk with you!

Are men welcome to give a lightning talk? Yes, men are welcome. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals. We will prioritize women and non-binary individuals for the talks, but encourage all to apply!

We would especially love to hear from people who have not presented at a meetup or conference before. A lightning talk can be a great way to start out speaking, as it's quick, low-prep, and fun!

***Extension Dates:***
\- Proposal due: Friday 10/11 [https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9](https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9)
\- Notification of acceptance: Sunday 10/13

title: Construindo seu primeiro dashboard interativo com o {Shiny}
description:
Vagas Limitadas!

O Shiny √© um framework para criar aplicativos web de maneira f√°cil usando c√≥digo R, sem precisar de qualquer conhecimento de HTML, CSS ou JavaScript. Por outro lado, o Shiny possui componentes de interface de usu√°rio que podem ser facilmente personalizadas ou estendidas, e seu servidor usa programa√ß√£o reativa para permitir que voc√™ crie qualquer tipo de l√≥gica de back-end que desejar. Atualmente, o Shiny √© usado em quase tantos nichos e ind√∫strias quanto o pr√≥prio R. Na academia √© usado como um meio chamativo para exibir novos resultados, m√©todos ou modelos estat√≠sticos e em empresas para configurar pain√©is de m√©tricas em tempo real que incorporam an√°lises avan√ßadas. Este minicurso foi projetado para lev√°-lo de n√£o saber nada sobre Shiny para ser capaz de construir dashboards, onde voc√™ ser√° capaz de expor seus resultados de maneira interativa que ainda s√£o f√°ceis de manter e de alto desempenho.

title: Dataviz 2.0 | publication-ready plots & tables
description:
Moving ahead with ggplot2!

WHO is this for?

* If you are newish to R but have dabbled a bit!
* If you have heard about ggplot2 and want to learn more.
* If you have a neat dataset, you'd like to explore w/ basic statistics!
* If you want to generate publication-ready figures and tables w/ R

* If any of this is true, this workshop might be for you!

AGENDA
5:00‚Äì5:10 Meet & Greet \| üçï\| Set\-up

title: Lunch&Learn: Code like a pro using AI with GitHub Copilot
description:
Ever wished there was a version of ChatGPT to help you write R code right inside your favorite IDE, like RStudio or VS Code? Good news‚Äîthere is, and it‚Äôs called GitHub Copilot!

In this talk, Rebecca will demonstrate Copilot's powerful AI tools, including advanced code completion (it can write entire multi-line functions from a single comment!) and a chatbot that can "see" your whole code file. Copilot can save you time and brain juice, even if you're already an R pro. While GitHub Copilot is proprietary software owned by Microsoft, meaning it comes with a cost and is only fully available in VS Code (which is also owned by Microsoft), a "light" version with more limited functionality is supported in RStudio.

To get started, you‚Äôll need a GitHub account, you should have VS Code and RStudio installed, and have an active GitHub Copilot subscription. During the live demo, Rebecca will also provide resources to help you kick off your Copilot journey.

title: NASA Space Apps Challenge 2024
description:
R-Ladies Community welcomes you to the NASA Space Apps Challenge Switzerland!

We are thrilled to bring this exciting event to Switzerland for the first time, inviting you to join us for a weekend of innovation, collaboration, and creativity. This unique hackathon brings together brilliant minds from diverse backgrounds to tackle real-world problems using NASA's vast collection of open data.

**About NASA Space Apps Challenge**
The NASA Space Apps Challenge is a global hackathon that engages communities around the world in addressing real-world problems, fostering innovation, and promoting the spirit of exploration. Established in 2012, this event has seen tremendous growth, with over 29,000 participants from more than 200 cities in 80+ countries. And now, for the very first time, Switzerland will join this global community of innovators!

**What to Expect**
**Collaborate:** Work with fellow participants from various fields, including science, technology, engineering, design, and entrepreneurship.
**Innovate:** Use NASA's open data to create solutions for real-world challenges related to Earth, space exploration, and beyond.
**Create:** Develop exciting applications, tools, and projects that can make a difference in the world and beyond.

**Who Can Participate?**
Anyone with a passion for solving problems and a desire to make an impact is welcome to join. Whether you're a seasoned coder, a creative designer, a passionate scientist, or a project manager, your skills are valuable, and your contributions can make a difference.

**Why Participate?**
**Global Recognition:** Join a prestigious global community of innovators and showcase your talents on an international stage.
**Networking:** Meet and collaborate with like-minded individuals, industry experts, and potential mentors.
**Prizes**: Stand a chance to win exciting prizes and gain opportunities for further development and exposure of your projects.
**Impact**: Use your skills to create solutions that can help address some of the most pressing challenges faced by humanity.

**How to Join?**

1. Create a profile at https://www.spaceappschallenge.org/
2. Chose location: Switzerland -> **[Zurich](https://www.spaceappschallenge.org/nasa-space-apps-2024/2024-local-events/zurich/)** and press "join"
3. Press "going" at[ local even](https://www.linkedin.com/events/7219723567330934785/comments/)t and share with your friends!

For more information, visit our [website](https://www.spaceappschallenge.org/) and follow us on [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/company/18940634/)
Check out our[ local page](https://techlegion.ch/SpaceApps.html) as well.

Don't forget to chose your location - onsite and virtual :
https://www.spaceappschallenge.org/nasa-space-apps-2024/2024-local-events/zurich/

**Let's Innovate Together!**
We can't wait to see the incredible ideas and projects that will come out of the first-ever NASA Space Apps Challenge in Switzerland. Join us for this groundbreaking event and be part of a global movement to use open data for the betterment of our world and beyond.

For more information, visit our websites: https://www.spaceappschallenge.org/
https://www.linkedin.com/company/space-apps-ch/
https://www.linkedin.com/events/7219723567330934785/comments/

Let's make history together at the NASA Space Apps Challenge Switzerland!

title: Intro to modular programming w/ R functions
description:
WHAT TO EXPECT
This workshop will provide a practical introductory overview (with hands-on practice) with writing R functions.

**WHO is this for?**

* If you'd like to automate common tasks into an efficient way
* If you're interested in creating nested functions for complicated computation
* If you'd like to customize functions from the existing R packages

**TOPICS**

* Learn the structure of function
* Pass parameters and return values by calling functions
* Understand local variables and global variables
* Control and handle errors in a function
* A better practice of function writing

**SET-UP**
To benefit most from this workshop, please bring your laptop with pre-installed RStudio ([https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/](https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rstudio.com%2Fproducts%2Frstudio%2F&data=05%7C02%7CKEWALIN.SAMART%40CUANSCHUTZ.EDU%7C954ada6fb6964c5d83d308dcd340115c%7C563337caa517421aaae01aa5b414fd7f%7C0%7C0%7C638617519334849043%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=oNrs2FYuSBktwxX%2BhxPKVAVLjVp2fU2hZXRsfNkBCqU%3D&reserved=0 "Original URL: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/. title: Data Wrangling Practice with R
description:
Join us for an engaging session on ‚Äú***Data Wrangling with R***‚Äù hosted by ***R-Ladies Rome***! This interactive workshop is specifically designed to introduce participants to the essential techniques and tools necessary for effective data wrangling using the R programming language.

In today‚Äôs data-driven world, the ability to manipulate and prepare data is crucial for analysis and decision-making. This workshop aims to equip attendees with the skills needed to clean, transform, and organize datasets efficiently. Participants will learn how to utilize tidyverse R packages, which are fundamental for performing operations like filtering, sorting, and summarizing data.

Throughout the session, we will provide hands-on exercises to reinforce learning, allowing participants to practice their skills in real-time. Whether you are a beginner looking to gain confidence in data manipulation or an intermediate user aiming to refine your techniques, this workshop will cater to all levels of experience.

By the end of the workshop, participants will have a solid understanding of data wrangling concepts and be able to apply these techniques to their own projects. Additionally, attendees will benefit from networking opportunities with fellow data enthusiasts and experts in the field.

Don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity to enhance your data wrangling skills and become a more proficient user of R. We look forward to seeing you there!

title: satuRday with R-Ladies: R for beginneRs
description:
Join us for an in-person Meetup to learn the basics of managing data with tidyverse and creating basic plots with ggplot2.

Download materials to participate from the [R-Ladies St. Louis GitHub](https://github.com/rladiesstl/meetup-september-2024).

Here is the schedule:\`

9am‚Äì10:30am Introduction to data management with tidyverse
10:30‚Äì10:45 BREAK
10:45‚Äì12:15 More tidyverse and ggplot2 for graphs
12:15‚Äì12:45 lunch\* and networking

\* We will provide a light lunch at the end of the workshop and the room will be open to network with each other and to chat with the R-Ladies team about your ideas for future Meetups. Recommend bringing a water bottle or cup to fill if needed. If you have dietary restrictions please bring your own refreshments.

DIRECTIONS:
We will meet in Goldfarb Hall Room 132 on the Washington University campus.
\* Goldfarb Hall is on Forsyth about 1.5 blocks west of Skinker
\* Park in free parking garage by turning from Forsyth onto Wrighton Way about a block west of Skinker and accessing the garage. It is free on the weekends but will make you take a ticket to get in; when you leave you'll need the ticket to get out but there will be no charge.
\* Leave the parking garage on the southwest corner (signs near the stairs say Brown School)
\* The big round glass building in front of you is Hillman Hall, Goldfarb is the brick building right next to it to the west

venues.name: Brown School
venues.address: Washington University in St. Louis, Goldfarb Hall 132

title: Minicurso: Creaci√≥n de paquetes en R
description:
**En este mini curso analizaremos los elementos b√°sicos para la creaci√≥n de paquetes en R de la mano de la Dra. Joselyn C. Ch√°vez Fuentes, miembro de R-Ladies Cuernavaca y CDSB. Actualmente realiza una estancia postdoctoral en el Departamento de Medicina Personalizada de la Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, en la ciudad de Nueva York. Se encuentra involucrada en el desarrollo del paquete Giotto para la visualizaci√≥n de datos espaciales de single cell en R.**

title: Grow Your Career In Tech: #IamRemarkable Workshop
description:
Are you battling with imposter syndrome at work? Struggling to find the confidence to speak up and acknowledge your worth? Join the **#IamRemarkable workshop** on Thursday, **September 26th 2024**.

#IAmRemarkable is a global movement founded by Google that empowers everyone to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond.
Over 600k people joined the initiative and 82% of them reported a confidence boost thanks to the insights and the activities shared in the workshop.

title: posit::conf(2024) watch party!
description:
Join us on Wednesday, September 25th from 5:30-7:00pm for a special posit::conf(2024) \**sneak peek* watch party, where we‚Äôll dive into a few exciting talks that focus on documentation, reproducibility, and collaboration. You can expect some networking and discussion, popcorn, and these great speakers:

1. **Why‚Äôd you load that package for? - Luis D. Verde Arregoitia:** (lightning talk)
2. **Context is King - Shannon Pileggi:** (Abstract) The quality of data science insights is predicated on the practitioner‚Äôs understanding of the data. Data documentation is the key to unlocking this understanding; with minimal effort, this documentation can be natively embedded in R data frames via variable labels. Variable labels seamlessly provide valuable data context that reduces human error, fosters collaboration, and ultimately elevates the overall data analysis experience. As an avid, daily user of variable labels, I am excited to help you discover new workflows to create and leverage variable labels in R!
3. **‚ÄúPlease Let Me Merge Before I Start Crying‚Äù: And Other Things I‚Äôve Said at the Git Terminal - Meghan Harris:** (Abstract) This talk is geared towards those who may feel comfortable working independently with Git but need some confidence when working collaboratively. Just like novice drivers can learn to confidently (and safely!) merge onto (seemingly) intimidating highways, those new to collaborating with Git can also conquer Git merges with some exposure and preparation. This talk will go over: different ways R users can interact with Git, what Git merges and Git merge conflicts are, real-life examples of Git merges, advice on resolving Git merges, and suggestions for cleaner workflows to promote better Git merges

\**While you won‚Äôt yet find the public links to this year‚Äôs talks, we are still able to stream recordings from our virtual attendee profile!*

We‚Äôll supply some light refreshments, but please feel free to bring something to share. See you there!

Your R-Ladies SB co-organizers,
Sam, Danielle, Camila

title: R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks (Prep & Brainstorm Workshop) (2 of 2)
description:
We are excited to host an online version of one our most popular events this fall - R-Ladies NYC Lightning Talks! We are holding this workshop to provide guidance and support for interested speakers. If you are interested in proposing a talk but want to brainstorm ideas, get feedback, or some encouragement, join us!

***What are lightning talks?***
Lighting talks are five minute talks. You can talk about anything R, Python, Tech, and/or Data Science related. Looking for ideas? How about talking about a cool package you found, how you use R/Python in your company, a favorite learning resource, your journey into Data Science, or a side project you've been working on?

Prior lightning talk topics include: 1-Automating Reports with Gmailr; 2-Using Shiny to Avoid Boring Tasks at Work; 3-How to Do VLOOKUP in R; 4-Balancing Business and Technical Requirements; 5-Pie Charts: Friend or Foe?

Are men welcome to give a lightning talk? Yes, men are welcome. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals. We will prioritize women and non-binary individuals for the talks, but encourage all to apply!

We would especially love to hear from people who have not presented at a meetup or conference before. A lightning talk can be a great way to start out speaking, as it's quick, low-prep, and fun!

***Important Dates***
**\- Prep & Brainstorm Workshops \(optional\): Thursday 9/12 or 9/19**
\- Submissions due: Friday 9/20 [https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9](https://forms.gle/3ahdFtx6eLDHvxeE9)
\- Notification of acceptance: Wednesday 9/25
\- Speakers to Confirm Participation: Friday 9/27
\- Submit slides to R\-Ladies: Friday 10/04
\- Lightning Talk Event: Sunday 10/06

title: Intro to Datviz
description:
WHAT TO EXPECT
This workshop will provide a practical introductory overview (with hands-on practice) with making data visualizations in R using ggplot2 ([https://ggplot2.org/](https://ggplot2.org/)).
Material: [github.com/rladies-aurora/202409-dataviz_intro](https://github.com/rladies-aurora/202409-dataviz_intro)

WHO is this for?

* If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
* If you'd like to start working with data in R w/o learning all the programming details first!!
* If you are getting started with base R and want to learn more!
* If you're interested in learning DataViz basics w/ R.
* If any of this is true, this workshop might be for you!

TOPICS

* why everyone talks about data visualization!
* how to pick the right visualization for your data
* overview of visualization packages: ggplot2, ggvis, leaflet, plotly
* why use ggplot2 in R for visualization
* the basics of 'aesthetics'
* the basics of 'geoms'
* other ways to customize the layout of your visualization

AGENDA
5:00‚Äì5:10 Meet & Greet \| üçï
5:10‚Äì5:15 Future Meetup planning + Set-up
5:15‚Äì6:15 Workshop: Intro to Data Visualization w/ R
6:20‚Äì6:30 Q&A

SET-UP

* To benefit most from this workshop, please bring your laptop with pre-installed RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) and R.
* Please ping us on Discord (https://discord.gg/hyZKcbGSWw) or email us (eastlansing@rladies.org) with questions, if any.

üí∞SPONSOR

* JRaviLab \(PI: Janani Ravi\) \| [https://jravilab.github.io](https://jravilab.github.io)

title: What is ‚Äúproduction‚Äù anyway? MLOps for the curious
description:
Join RLadies Sydney online for a Special Event with Julia Silge!
Please register on the Rladies Sydney Meetup page to attend the event online: https://meetu.ps/e/NjB8n/yxNGr/i

RLadies Sydney are thrilled to welcome Julia Silge, a data scientist and engineering manager at Posit PBC (formerly RStudio), where she works on open source modeling and MLOps tools.
She is a tool builder, an author, an international keynote speaker, and a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and machine learning. Julia loves text analysis, making beautiful charts, and communicating about technical topics with diverse audiences. You can find her online at her blog and YouTube.

Topic:

While data scientists are often taught about training a machine learning model, building an MLOps strategy to deploy and maintain that model can be daunting. In this talk, learn about MLOps concepts like model deployment and model drift, the different ways the word ‚Äúperformance‚Äù is used with models, what you can monitor about a model, how feedback loops impact models, and how you can set yourself up for success with model maintenance. This talk will help practitioners who are already deploying models, but this is also useful knowledge for data science practitioners earlier in their MLOps journey; decisions made along the way can make the difference between resilient models that are easier to maintain and disappointing or misleading models.

title: Intro to Spatial Data in R
description:
Join us for a practical session on spatial data analysis using the sf package in R! Perfect for both new and intermediate R users.

Why Attend?
\- Learn the basics of spatial data and the sf package\.
\- Discover how to visualize spatial data\.
\- See real\-world applications and examples\.
\- Get your questions answered in an interactive Q&A\.

**IMPORTANT**\*\*

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready
2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
3. I don't identify as one of the "ladies", but can I attend? Of course! Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities and underrepresented people in data science with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming languages in data science, which is R.

To be a part of our community, we ask participants to be actively respectful, encouraging, and supportive of each other.

title: R-Ladies Singapore: Getting to know you ‚ò∫Ô∏è
description:
Hi! Welcome to R-Ladies Singapore (RLSG). ‚ò∫Ô∏è
RLSG is a new addition to the R-Ladies community ([http://rladies.org](http://rladies.org/)) aiming to promote R's usage and exchange knowledge in R, especially for women and gender minorities. That said, **everyone is welcome to join our Meetups**, just that **priority will be given to women & gender minorities**.

Anyone interested in R regardless of proficiency may come join us.
So, please let us know what you hope to see in this local chapter so we may best tailor them to your interests and availabilities by filling up this survey ([https://forms.gle/bcWUpdc17mu2Gqhh8](https://forms.gle/bcWUpdc17mu2Gqhh8)) by 30 August.

Our first event will likely be in **Q4 2024**. We will keep you updated.

For any questions, please email: singapore@rladies.org

title: La gram√°tica de ggplot
description:
**Descripci√≥n del evento:**
En nuestro Meetup online, aprender√°s a utilizar la librer√≠a `ggplot2`, una herramienta poderosa para la visualizaci√≥n de datos en R. Con `ggplot2`, podr√°s generar una amplia variedad de gr√°ficos con un estilo coherente, incluyendo gr√°ficos de dispersi√≥n, burbuja, l√≠nea, series de tiempo, mapas de calor, treemap, gr√°ficos de barras, redes, y m√°s. En este taller nos enfocaremos principalmente en la gr√°matica de gr√°ficos que inspira el paquete, la cual propone que cualquier gr√°fico puede ser creado a partir de 3 componentes: *Set de datos*, *Sistema de coordenadas* y *Geometr√≠as.*

**Plataforma:** El taller se realizar√° online. Te enviaremos el enlace de acceso por correo electr√≥nico antes del evento.

Para el taller, es importante que tengas tu computador listo y que hayas descargado previamente R Project desde este link ->: [https://dirichlet.mat.puc.cl/](https://dirichlet.mat.puc.cl/) y la versi√≥n gratuita de R Studio desde este link ->: [https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)
Si es la primera vez que asistes a uno de nuestros eventos, recuerda revisar nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: [https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish](https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish)
ggplot es parte del universo de paquetes de Tidyverse, por lo que recomendamos revisar el material de nuestro taller pasado en el siguiente enlace: https://github.com/Rladies-Concepcion/Taller-Tidyverse-2024

A meta-an√°lise √© uma t√©cnica estat√≠stica poderosa que combina resultados de v√°rios estudos em um √∫nico resultado, permitindo conclus√µes mais precisas e confi√°veis. O R-Ladies √© uma organiza√ß√£o mundial, com a miss√£o de promover a diversidade de g√™nero na comunidade R e no mercado da tecnologia como um todo. title: posit::conf(2024) Community Mixer
description:
[posit::conf(2024)](https://posit.co/conference/) is an open-source data science conference happening in Seattle on August 12 - 14! From Posit, formerly RStudio, we have talk tracks, community events, updates on product enhancements, all-day workshops, and keynotes from your favorite data scientists.

Stick around after the final keynote of posit::conf(2024) for a chance to connect with community members from R-Ladies and PyLadies. This event is open to the public, attendees of posit::conf, and community members who are not registered for posit::conf may attend.

title: K-Means en R
description:
**DETALLES**
En este meetup, exploraremos las bases te√≥ricas y pr√°cticas del algoritmo K-means, una herramienta esencial para la agrupaci√≥n de datos masivos. Los participantes aprender√°n a implementar este algoritmo en R, interpretar los resultados y aplicar t√©cnicas para optimizar el proceso de clustering.

**AGENDA**
-Introducci√≥n
-Algoritmo K-Means
-K-Means
-Variantes de K-Means
-K-Means din√°mico
-Ejercicios con benchmark
-Comentarios finales

**FECHA**
Jueves 8 de agosto de 2024, 5 p.m. (CDMX)

**DESCARGA LOS MATERIALES EN:**
https://github.com/RLadiesCuerna/meetup_agosto_2024

**REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE**
\- R y RStudio
\- Librerias de R animation y ggplot2

Puedes instalarlas con las siguientes instrucciones:
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages("animation")

**C√ìDIGO DE CONDUCTA**
Recuerda leer y atender nuestro c√≥digo de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/ o https://rladiesmx.netlify.app/codigo_de_conducta/

title: Shiny 101
description:
Join us for a special event hosted by RLadies, featuring a talk by **Margaret Colville**, one of our dedicated members!

Have you heard about the Shiny package for building websites in R and wondered how to use it? In this talk Margaret will cover the basics of how it works and experiment with a simple example or two.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to create interactive dashboards or full-fledged web applications, this session will provide you with the foundational knowledge to get started.

*No prior experience with Shiny is required, but a basic understanding of R will be helpful.*

Join us and take advantage of Margaret‚Äôs commitment to empowering the community with her time and expertise!

***R-Ladies Sydney organisers***
***Thank you Nous Group for supporting the RLadies!***
*Find us on Twitter @rladiessydney and on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/14405806/) for more information on news, presentations and code!*
