By taking part in an R-Ladies Sydney event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community‚Äôs aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.\*
***Code of Conduct***\*: R-Ladies Sydney is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*

title: Networking and 5 √† 7
description:
Join R-Ladies Ottawa for an in-person networking event at Beyond the Pale! This is a great opportunity to meet other women and gender minorities from the Ottawa area who are interested in open-source while enjoying some delicious food and/or drinks!

**Please also note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community.** Our events are intended to provide a safe space **for women and gender minorities.**

title: C√≥mo preparar tu propuesta de presentaci√≥n para LatinR 2024
description:
¬°Hola!

¬°Ya est√° abierto el env√≠o de trabajos para [LatinR 2024](https://latinr.org/)! Este a√±o la conferencia latinoamericana sobre R se llevar√° a cabo en l√≠nea, entre el 18 y el 22 de noviembre. Esta modalidad la hace una excelente oportunidad para compartir lo que has estado haciendo con R con el resto de la comunidad, sin tener que moverte de tu casa.
Pero ¬øc√≥mo preparar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n?
¬øQu√© debiese incluir el abstract?
¬øLa idea que tengo es suficiente como para proponer algo?
¬øQu√© pasa si reci√©n estoy empezando a usar R?
¬øEs lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia acad√©mica de mi disciplina?
¬øQu√© tengo que tener en cuenta si quiero presentar sobre un paquete o una Shiny app que desarroll√©?
Para responder estas y otras preguntas nos reuniremos el pr√≥ximo jueves 1 de agosto. Durante la sesi√≥n, compartiremos recomendaciones para dise√±ar una propuesta y revisaremos algunos ejemplos de a√±os anteriores para que te hagas una idea de la variedad de temas que es posible presentar.

**¬øY si todav√≠a no tengo una idea concreta para una presentaci√≥n?**
No importa. Durante la sesi√≥n hablaremos tambi√©n sobre c√≥mo generar ideas. Si usas R, seguro que tienes algo para compartir con la comunidad.

**Preparaci√≥n**
Si a√∫n no tienes una cuenta en OpenReview (la plataforma que usa LatinR para env√≠os) te sugerimos hacerte una cuenta ahora, incluso si todav√≠a no tienes claro si vas a enviar una propuesta. OpenReview a veces se demora hasta dos semana en aprobar las cuentas nuevas que se crean con correos personales, as√≠ que es mejor no dejar este paso para √∫ltima hora.

**Acceso**

title: [Rescheduled] - Debugging in R
description:
\

So you have just started your R journey. The examples are well defined and everything is sunshine and rainbows. üåà what the workshops and tutorials didn‚Äôt prepare you for is the real world error messages and how to overcome them. There just wasn‚Äôt enough time! This workshop is intended to help you decide these messages and strategies on how to tackle your code problems with a minimal reproducible example.

Please submit your own error messages and code ahead of time using the form here: https://forms.gle/tAzRJ5QmUfSHyUBU7. This will help us tailor the workshop to your needs!

This workshop is intended for anyone who has some prior coding experience in R or other languages.

See you there!

Yuka, Jasmine and Cici

**IMPORTANT**\*\*

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready
2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
3. I don't identify as one of the "ladies", but can I attend? Of course! Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities and underrepresented people in data science with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming languages in data science, which is R.

To be a part of our community, we ask participants to be actively respectful, encouraging, and supportive of each other.

**Note to access the zoom you will need to enter with a password we will email out the password in an email before the event**

title: Choosing the right chart for your data
description:
Join us for an engaging meetup where we'll dive into the art and science of data visualization with our topic: "Choosing the Right Chart for Your Data." Whether you're a seasoned data analyst, a beginner just getting started, or a professional from any field working with data, this event will equip you with the knowledge to effectively communicate your data insights.
**What to Expect:**

* **Introduction to Data Visualization Principles:** Understand the key principles of effective data visualization and why choosing the right chart is crucial.
* **Chart Types and Their Uses:** This section provides a comprehensive overview of various chart types, including bar charts, line charts, pie charts, scatter plots, histograms, and more. Learn about their strengths, weaknesses, and best scenarios for their use.
* **Practical Examples:** Dive into real-world examples and case studies to see how different charts can transform raw data into compelling stories.
* **Interactive Q&A Session:** Have data visualization expert, Yan answer your questions and share your experiences with chart selection.

**Who Should Attend:**

* Data analysts and scientists looking to enhance their visualization skills.
* Business professionals who need to present data insights clearly and effectively.
* Students and educators in data-related fields.
* Anyone interested in improving their ability to communicate data.

title: R-Ladies NYC Social: A night at Talea Brewery!
description:
Join R-Ladies NYC for a summer social at Talea Brewery!

For the first hour, we will take data from Open Brewery DB, free and open source brewery data, and demonstrate how to make graphs and visuals of the data using R! New to R and/or have never used R before? No worries! **You do not need any prior experience with R to follow along** \- just bring your laptop and positive attitude\! After the demonstration\, we will have the rest of the time to network\, socialize\, and share some of our graphics\. Food and drinks \(and free swag\) are on us\! The only thing you need to bring to this event is your laptop\.

This event will be held at Talea Brewery in Williamsburg:
87 RICHARDSON STREET
BROOKLYN, NY 11211

Please RSVP here on Meetup so we have an idea for attendance. Make sure to bring your laptop to this event!

To learn more about R-Laides NYC: [https://www.rladiesnyc.org/](https://www.rladiesnyc.org/). R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events? Yes, men are welcome. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

title: Building Reproducible Pipelines with R, Docker and Nix
description:
üïµÔ∏è Discover essential tools and best practices for creating reproducible workflows. üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüî•

In this talk, **[Dr. Bruno Rodrigues](https://www.linkedin.com/in/brodriguesco/)** will present some ideas and tools needed to build **reproducible pipelines with R, Docker an Nix**. Bruno will discuss best coding practices (moving away from "script-based" workflows), Docker to containerize analyses and Nix, a powerful package manager that can be used within, or outside of Docker.

After the talk, participants will have enough knowledge to start using these tools for their analyses! ‚õ≥Ô∏è

‚è∞ Don‚Äôt miss out on this insightful session empower your with practical knowledge! ü§©

The examples are well defined and everything is sunshine and rainbows. üåà what the workshops and tutorials didn‚Äôt prepare you for is the real world error messages and how to overcome them. There just wasn‚Äôt enough time! This workshop is intended to help you decide these messages and strategies on how to tackle your code problems with a minimal reproducible example.

Please submit your own error messages and code ahead of time using the form here: https://forms.gle/tAzRJ5QmUfSHyUBU7. This will help us tailor the workshop to your needs!

This workshop is intended for anyone who has some prior coding experience in R or other languages.

See you there!

Yuka, Jasmine and Cici

**IMPORTANT**\*\*

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready
2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
3. I don't identify as one of the "ladies", but can I attend? Of course! Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities and underrepresented people in data science with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming languages in data science, which is R.

To be a part of our community, we ask participants to be actively respectful, encouraging, and supportive of each other.

title: Intro R and RStudio Workshop (hybrid)
description:
Join the Seattle R-Ladies in this 1.5-hour workshop where we introduce R and RStudio at the beginner level. This workshop is open to R-Ladies members representing minority genders including but not limited to cis women, trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, and agender individuals. You do not have to be in the Seattle area to attend virtually.

Content

In this workshop, we cover:

R and RStudio including projects, scripts, and packages
The help function
Reading in data as a data frame and RData
Data types

Pre-requisites

You do not need any prior experience in R or coding!

Format

This is a hybrid workshop. In person attendees, please find information on the event location at UW South Lake Union on this page. Virtual attendees will receive a Zoom link the day of the workshop.

Materials

https://bigslu.github.io/workshops/introR.workshop/introR.html

title: Developing Software Together Using GIt and RStudio
description:
Never save report_fertig_fertig_letzte-version.Rmd file again. In this tutorial you will learn how to use Git to track your work and collaborate with others and your future self.

Materials: https://paocorrales.github.io/git-developing-software-together/
Preparation: https://paocorrales.github.io/git-developing-software-together/preparation.html

About the Speaker:
Elio Campitelli has a Ph.D. from Universidad de Buenos Aires in atmospheric sciences, where they studied the large-scale circulation of the Southern Hemisphere and now studies tropical influences on Antarctic sea ice at Monash University. They also taught Introduction to Programming, and Visualization of Information at Universidad Nacional Guillermo Brown and is a The Carpentries certified instructor. They are an active member of the R community, and maintains several open-source R packages (e.g., ggnewscale; metR).

title: Understanding Mixed-Effects Models through Simulation
description:
**WORKSHOP OVERVIEW:**
In this talk, we will delve into the increasingly popular mixed-effects models, frequently employed in experimental fields such as psycholinguistics where data are nested within participants and items. These models can often appear opaque, making it challenging to grasp what specific parameters signify and how they are reflected in the data.
Through the power of simulation, we aim to demystify these models by constructing and manipulating their parameters from scratch. This approach not only aids in a deeper comprehension of the models but also serves as an invaluable tool for conducting power analysis and refining experimental predictions.
Key areas we will explore include:

* Simulating data and see whether the model estimates mirror our expectations.
* Understanding random effects and how to simulate them.
* Exploring how simulation techniques can be used for power analysis.

This session is designed to be useful for a wide audience but of course familiarity with the lme4 package and R will help. If you would like to familiarize yourself with data simulation, you can have a look at my blog posts about this topic ([https://julianquandt.com/categories/power-analysis/](https://julianquandt.com/categories/power-analysis/)).

**ONLINE PROGRAMME**
The workshop will be held online, starting on 12th July at 12:00 pm (UK Summer time). Please join us via this Zoom link:
[https://bham-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/84906376457?pwd=alZGSFY4SmJzVjRHb2FJMm9zS0NuQT09](https://bham-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/84906376457?pwd=alZGSFY4SmJzVjRHb2FJMm9zS0NuQT09)
Meeting ID: 849 0637 6457
Passcode: 163231

**SPEAKER:**
Julian Quandt, currently a postdoctoral researcher at WU Vienna University of Economics and Business, completed his PhD studies in Psychology at Radboud University, Nijmegen, focusing on metacognition in value-based decision making. During his doctoral studies, faced with the absence of a standard tool for power analysis for Mixed-Effects Models, he used data simulation instead. Through this process, he discovered the power of data simulation as a tool for learning and enhancing his own understanding of statistical models. Julian authored four blog posts on data simulation, covering both simple and complex statistical models. His intention was to share his intuition that simulation can serve as a valuable tool for comprehending these models, in addition to enabling us to conduct power analysis for (nearly) any statistical model.

**CODE OF CONDUCT**
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct - we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment:
https://github.com/rladies/.github/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Bringing R to Serverless Cloud Computing
description: Over the past several years, two technologies have undergirded many of the most innovative research projects and tools developed by the Urban Institute: the R programming language and Amazon Web Services (AWS) Lambda. Despite their respective prevalence, R and Lambda have largely existed in isolation because Lambda does not natively support R. The presentation will describe efforts to address this barrier. The framework for running R code using AWS Lambda and examples of projects will be discussed.

title: Spatial Workflows in R
description:
Join us on **Thursday, July 11 from 5:30-7pm PDT** to learn the ins and outs of spatial workflows!

Dealing with spatial data through coding can be challenging, but is a useful skill across many different fields of expertise. In this session, we will cover the basics of working with spatial data in R, giving you the tools you need to handle spatial data confidently and accurately. We will demonstrate many parts of the spatial data workflow, from data import and manipulation, to basic and advanced data visualization using a suite of different R packages. Finally, we will take it a step further and give an example of how we can use spatial data for decision-making by providing a basic workflow for spatial prioritization in a conservation context.

This event will be **virtual**! A zoom link will be provided directly to folks who RSVP.

If you'd like to code along during the workshop, there are several options for accessing the workshop material:

1. If you're a git and GitHub user, you can [fork and clone the GitHub repository](https://github.com/SnBuenafe/RLadies_SpatPrio_Workshop) ***(recommended)***. For guidelines on how to do so, you can find some instructions [here](https://github.com/samanthacsik/cute-cats-dogs/wiki/Forking-&-Cloning-a-GitHub-respository) \- noting that you will be using Tin and Sandra's repository\, instead of the repository in the example\!
2. If you're not a GitHub user, you can [download the necessary materials via Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tUuCMVxkKt79k-frYXyA_GVjU6SEf9NO?usp=sharing).

There are several R packages that will be installed and loaded as we work through the workshop material. Some may take some time to install, so if you'd like to install packages ahead of time, you can follow the code in load_packages.R.

title: R-Ladies Monthly Happy Hour
description:

Chips and salsa provided!

Non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab.

title: R-Ladies Meetup Dinner
description:
In the beginning of July this year, the largest user conference for the statistical software environment R ‚Äì useR! 2024 (https://events.linuxfoundation.org/user/) ‚Äì will take place. For the first time in almost 20 years, this conference will be held again in Austria, specifically in Salzburg. As part of the social program for R-Ladies, we would like to host a welcoming event. Join us during a nice informal dinner in a traditional Salburger location. Engage in informal conversation with R-Ladies from all over the world and get to know the speakers of the useR conference.

Cost: Entrance and participation are FREE. Participation is NOT limited to conference attendees! Food and drinks are to be paid separately (registered participants will be informed about the options).

Registration is required.

R-Ladies is an organisation that promotes gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities.

Code of Conduct
R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.
This code of conduct applies to all R-Ladies spaces, including meetups, Twitter, Slack, mailing lists, both online and offline. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the Global Leadership Team.
Participants are responsible for knowing and abiding by these rules.
Harassment includes:

* Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, age, race, or religion.
* Unwelcome comments regarding a person‚Äôs lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
* Deliberate misgendering or use of ‚Äòdead‚Äô or rejected names.
* Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behaviour in spaces where they‚Äôre not appropriate.
* Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like ‚Äú*hug*‚Äù or ‚Äú*backrub*‚Äù) without consent or after a request to stop.
* Threats of violence.
* Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
* Deliberate intimidation.
* Stalking or following.
* Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
* Sustained disruption of discussion.
* Unwelcome sexual attention.
* Pattern of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others.
* Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
* Deliberate ‚Äúouting‚Äù of any aspect of a person‚Äôs identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
* Publication of non-harassing private communication.

R-Ladies prioritizes marginalized people‚Äôs safety over privileged people‚Äôs comfort. The Global Leadership Team will not act on complaints regarding:

* ‚ÄòReverse‚Äô -isms, including ‚Äòreverse racism,‚Äô ‚Äòreverse sexism,‚Äô and ‚Äòcisphobia‚Äô.
* Reasonable communication of boundaries, such as ‚Äúleave me alone,‚Äù ‚Äúgo away,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not discussing this with you.‚Äù
* Communicating in a ‚Äôtone‚Äô you don‚Äôt find congenial.
* Criticizing racist, sexist, cissexist, or otherwise oppressive behavior or assumptions.

title: Women in Technology: Web Development Workshop | Building a Website in R
description:
Join **R-Ladies Rome & R-Ladies NYC** for a **hands-on workshop** focused on Web Development specifically tailored for women in technology.

The event will provide a platform for professional networking, skill-building, and empowerment for women interested in expanding their knowledge in Web Technology and Open Source tools. Through practical sessions and discussions, attendees will have the opportunity to **explore the essentials of Quarto**, from setting up your development environment to customizing your site's design and functionality.

By the end of the tutorial, you'll have a **fully functional, personalized website** where to showcase your projects and achievements.

Don't miss this chance to enhance your skills and be part of a supportive community of **women in technology**!

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-Hands\-on Session Setup\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

* Please have the latest version of RStudio installed or sign up for Posit Cloud ([https://posit.cloud/plans](https://posit.cloud/plans)). If you are using another tool, please ensure Quarto CLI is installed on your computer ([https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)).
* Throughout the tutorial, we will be referencing the Quarto guide for RStudio ([https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/hello/rstudio.html](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/hello/rstudio.html)) as well as W3Schools CSS tutorials ([https://www.w3schools.com/css/default.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/css/default.asp)).
* The tutorial will also go over how to use Git and GitHub for version control, but this is optional.
* You can set up version control with GitHub at a later point. That said, if you wish to follow along with the tutorial, we suggest you to create a GitHub account and connect it to RStudio ([https://happygitwithr.com/rstudio-git-github](https://happygitwithr.com/rstudio-git-github)) before the meetup.
* Lastly, we will be using Quarto Pub ([https://quartopub.com/](https://quartopub.com/)) to publish the website. Again, if you wish to follow along during the tutorial, please create a an account ahead of time. The Quarto website also has information about publishing with other platforms ([https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/](https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/)).
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

title: Building a Website in R
description:
Join us for an interactive hands-on tutorial on web development with R, where you'll learn to build your own website/portfolio using Quarto.

This event is designed for both beginners and experienced R users who want to expand their skills into web development. We'll cover the essentials of Quarto, from setting up your development environment to customizing your site's design and functionality. By the end of the tutorial, you'll have a fully functional, personalized website where to showcase your projects and achievements.

Dive into the world of web development with R and Quarto, and transform your data and analysis into a stunning online presence!

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group (on a Wednesday)
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

At this event, we'll revisit one of the Tidy Tuesday datasets from October 2023 on Taylor Swift album and song lyrics via the taylor R package (https://taylor.wjakethompson.com/). You can read more about it here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2023/2023-10-17/readme.md and see some previous analysis of the data here: https://rpubs.com/salvatoremancino/1065547.

Agenda (all times in ET):
6:30 - 6:45 pm Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm #tidytuesday
7:45 - 8:00 pm Discussion

What is #tidytuesday?
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out [this blog post](https://bit.ly/2HqEsdt) and [the main repository page](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday).

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Democratizing Methods for Causal Inference
description:
Join R-Ladies NYC for a talk by Jennifer Hill.

The past few decades have seen an explosion in the development of freely available software to implement statistical methods and algorithms to help us explore and analyze data. However researchers tend to assume that once they have made their software available through CRAN or on GitHub that their job is done. Typically, very little attention is paid to ensuring that the software is easy to use or unlikely to be used incorrectly. Even less attention is paid to helping researchers new to a method to understand the underlying assumption or how to appropriate interpret the output.

In this talk, I will describe a new software tool for causal inference that works to scaffold the user experience to maximize the probability that researchers can use the tool appropriately and understand the foundational ideas. Moreover, I'll describe a randomized experiment we performed to understand whether this tool actually accomplishes these goals relative to traditional software.

[RSVP HERE](https://forms.gle/Au7xXdmu4ePscT7c8) \| The passcode to login to the event will be emailed to registrants on the morning of June 25\.

**R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending): [https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct).**

**For questions regarding accessibility, please email nyc@[rladies.org](http://rladies.org/).**

title: R-Ladies Social after Cascadia R Conference
description:
Join us for a social after Cascadia R Conference! This event is open to all Cascadia R Conf attendees as well as R-Ladies and useR! members even if you did not attend the conf.

Cascadia R Conference is an R conference serving the Pacific Northwest (OR/WA/BC). This event is a place to come together around R and get together with like-minded people across the region. Interested? [Learn more on their website and register today](https://cascadiarconf.com/)!

The conference concludes at 6 pm on June 22. Afterwards, we invite R-Ladies and other attendees to join us at a social gathering. Come even if you didn't attend the conference. It's a great time to meet and chat with other R enthusiasts from the area!

We will share the location closer to the event. Please note, each member will be responsible for covering their own food expenses. We appreciate your understanding and hope to see you there.

title: Reproducible pipelines book club: Q&A with the author Bruno Rodrigues
description:
We are happy to announce an extra special meeting in our book club where we will host Bruno Rodrigues, the author of [‚ÄúBuilding Reproducible Analytical Pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/).

During this meeting, Bruno will present an additional reproducibility tip, not included in the book. Afterward, we will hold a Q&A session where everyone is invited to ask a question.

What topic or burning question do you have for the author? It's a great opportunity, so feel free to ask! We will send a link to a shared document where you can write your questions, concerns, or compliments.

Thanks to all for joining us on this joint book club venture with R-Ladies Cologne and R-Ladies Bergen. And a special thanks to those of you who volunteered to present the chapters. We really enjoyed our sessions together and wish everyone much reproducible progress to come.

What topic or burning question do you have for the author? It's a great opportunity, so feel free to ask! We will send a link to a shared document where you can write your questions, concerns, or compliments.

Thanks to all for joining us on this joint book club venture with R-Ladies Cologne and R-Ladies Bergen. And a special thanks to those of you who volunteered to present the chapters. We really enjoyed our sessions together and wish everyone much *reproducible* progress to come.

title: Networking at summerstage
description:
As our last event before the summer we would be happy if you joined us for some drinks and networking next Wednesday from 18:00 onwards at summerstage (Donaukanal). It would be a great opportunity to get to know each other or simply catch up, and also to let us know if you have any input for how we continue with R Ladies Vienna.

Next events will then resume after the summer!

title: Data Science Salon NYC: JUNE 18TH FINANCE & TECHNOLOGY
description:
R-Ladies NYC are excited to be community partners with Data Science Salon NYC to promote their upcoming one-day event. **Please note: this event is not free. You must purchase tickets at [www.datascience.salon/newyork/](https://www.datascience.salon/newyork/)**

[Data Science Salon NYC on June 18th, 2024](https://www.datascience.salon/newyork) is an annual one-day 150 person conference focused on AI and machine learning applications in finance & technology. The intimate event takes place at [S&P Global Ratings in Manhattan, New York, NY](https://www.datascience.salon/newyork/#venue) and brings local industry leaders and specialists face-to-face to educate each other on innovative solutions in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive analytics and acceptance around best practices.

Featuring speakers from **S&P Global, JP Morgan Chase, CIti, Capital One, Nubank, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, Finder, T. Rowe Price and many more!**

You will see a mix of use-cases, technical talks and panel conversations, and you will walk away with actionable insights from those working on the frontlines of machine learning in finance & technology. All sessions are recorded and are available on-demand for two weeks.

The fifth annual Data Science Salon NYC gathers the most diverse community in the data science field, bringing together executives, senior data science practitioners, data science managers, analysts, and engineering professionals. The format includes an optional expo and lots of time for networking in a casual environment with entertainment.

**Topics Include:**

* Enterprise AI Use Cases in the Finance Sector
* AI Governance
* Natural Language Processing & Deep Learning
* Scalability and LLMOps
* Data Science Teams: Managing, Building, Collaboration
* LLMs in Production
* Generative AI in the Enterprise
* Multilingual LLMs
* Open Source Tools into your workflows
* Designing ML pipelines efficiently
* and much more!

**Why attend the DSS NYC experience?**

* Meet and connect with the most diverse senior technical community in the space
* Improve your skills in 20+ engaging sessions, including use-cases, technical deep dives, and panel conversations
* Learn from practitioners, technical experts and executives what AI and machine learning mean to finance & technology
* Ask expert speakers questions in live Q&A sessions
* Access all sessions on-demand until two weeks after the event

**Grab your spot** at [www.datascience.salon/newyork/](https://www.datascience.salon/newyork/)
DSS NYC also offers discounted rates for groups, nonprofits and more.

title: Intro to R and R Studio
description:
**Hello R Ladies of Honolulu!**

**We are excited to announce our second event, which will occur on June 13th, 2024 at the Entrepreneur's Sandbox and at Honolulu Beerworks. Dr. Lansing Perng, a recent PhD recipient from University of Hawai‚Äôi Manoa, will be test-running an intro to R course she has been working on for a college-level course.**

**Don't forget to bring your laptops, this course will include follow-along coding.**

\*\*Any and all levels are encouraged to attend - this is a great opportunity for R beginners to learn the basics, and a chance for seasoned R practitioners to reflect on teaching methods that have been most effective for them over the years. If there are others who are working on R-related curriculum, we would love to hear about it and work that into the general discussion as well! Make sure to bring your laptops! \*\*

**After, we‚Äôll walk over to Honolulu Beer Co for drinks and some post-work socializing.**

**Please RSVP by June 12th, and please let us know if you have any questions!**

**When: 6:30 pm - 8:00 pm**
**Where: Entrepreneur‚Äôs Sandbox & Honolulu Beerworks**

**All the best,**
**Jayslen, Maddie, Juliette and Emily**

title: R-Ladies Monthly Happy Hour
description:
Join R-Ladies Seattle for our monthly happy hour! Come and network with local R-Ladies to make new connections and discuss all things R. This is a casual event so you can stop by any time. You'll find us by our logo (and probably Kim's rainbow hair).

Chips and salsa provided!

Non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab.

title: R-Ladies Coffee and Code Hangout
description:
Come join R-Ladies NY for another evening of coding and coffee. This will be an informal, hands-on working session where we'll work together on our own projects or tutorials.

Come in curious about a subject or looking to make progress on a project you're working on!

BYOLaptop :) All experience levels welcome!

Some possible things we'll be working on:
\- Posit Table Contest \(the deadline is June 15th\!\)
\- TidyTuesday
\- web scrapping with rvest
\- making your website/portfolio with R
\- package development
\- Anything and everything\! Bring a project or idea you want to work on\!

Find us at the tables in the cafe!

title: Personal R Administration
description:
Does the release of a new R version fill you with dread?
Are there passwords in your R code?
Do you look at the output of a failed package installation and think to yourself, ‚ÄúWTF?!‚Äù
If you said yes to any of those question, then you need Personal R Administration. You'll come away with tips, tricks, tweaks, and some hacks for building data science dev environments that you won't be afraid to come back to in a year.

title: [ONLINE] Personal R Administration Workshop with Shannon Pileggi & David Aja
description:
Come join your fellow R users from R-Ladies RTP and R-Ladies Gaborone in a joint virtual meet up.

Does the release of a new R version fill you with dread? Are there passwords in your R code? Do you look at the output of a failed package installation and think to yourself, ‚ÄúWTF?!‚Äù If you said yes to any of those question, then you need Personal R Administration. You'll come away with tips, tricks, tweaks, and some hacks for building data science R development environments that you won't be afraid to come back to in a year.

This is a half-day long hands-on event based on the "What They Forgot To Teach You About R" workshop that Shannon and David co-teach every year at posit::conf. For more on that workshop, visit: https://rstats.wtf/.

**Who is this for?**
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world. This meetup is organized in collaboration with R-Ladies Gaborone.

**What should I bring?**
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities, R, and RStudio. If you have difficulties installing R and/or RStudio, please reach out to the organize at least 24 hours before the event.

**Where will it take place?**
Please join us online via Zoom. A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for minoritized genders as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend as guests and must be accompanied by the member who invited them. This group was created so that women, non-binary, gender non-conforming, and minoritized folks have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Launch of BaR Chat Networking Series
description:
R-ladies Amsterdam is launching the very first **BaR Chat** event.
After two successful events and the summer ahead of us, we thought it would be a great moment to introduce a networking event series.

Whether you're new in town or a local; a student or working professional; a tea-lover or coffee-lover, new to R or experienced; you are invited to join R-Ladies Amsterdam for a drink.

Location: Volkshotel (ground floor on the left)
Walk-in between 18:00 - 21:00
Drinks at own expense.

Hope to see you on the June 5th!

PS: If you can't make it this time don't worry, there will be more events like this in the future ;)

title: RYouWithMe? MarkyMark!
description:
Come join us for a **hands-on session on the basics of R and Rstudio**!

This month we finish with the *"MarkyMark‚Äù*" modules of ***RYouWithMe,*** a series of online learning resources for using R - designed by us, for us.

The series is oriented towards R beginners and aims to provide a foundation for future RLadies Sydney activities.

You can start going through the Modules on your own and join us for questions, help and troubleshooting during the meetup.

Find it here: [https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/](https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/)

**How to get involved!**

As an R-Lady learner based in Sydney:

1. Join the R-Ladies Sydney Slack workspace ***[here](https://join.slack.com/t/rladies-sydney/shared_invite/zt-2czd4i8jq-qKuml1FeCHaJPuaYkRDXHQ)***;
2. Introduce yourself in the *#ryouwithme_intros_2024 channel*;
3. Keep an eye out in the *#ryouwithme_general_2024* channel for announcements;
4. Share your successes, ask questions, help out your peers in the *#ryouwithme_help_2024*.
5.

Bring your laptop!

We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*

title: HOW TO: present results
description:
Na tokratni delavnici bomo raziskovali, kako smiselno in uƒçinkovito predstaviti podatke z uporabo paketa ggplot2 v R. Vabljeni, da prinesete tudi svoje rezultate, za katere niste prepriƒçani, kako jih uspe≈°no vizualizirati.
Poleg tega bomo spoznali paket SRAdb, ki omogoƒça neposreden prenos podatkov iz podatkovne baze SRA v okolje R.

**Delavnica bo potekala izkljuƒçno v ≈æivo!**
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
In this workshop, we will explore how to meaningfully and effectively present data using the ggplot2 package in R. We encourage you to bring your own results, especially if you're unsure how to visualize them successfully.
Additionally, we will introduce the SRAdv package, which allows direct retrieval of data from the SRA database into the R environment.

**The workshop will take place exclusively in person!**

title: Creative coding: make generative art with R
description:
Location: Room 37 Level B of Building 7, University of Canberra.

R is a programming language used widely for data analysis, but in this workshop, we will explore ways to make art! Building on the popular ggplot2 package, Dr. Emi Tanaka (ANU) will demonstrate how to draw Truchet tiles and other generative art where time permits. All codes demonstrated will be shared with the participants. Come join the workshop to meet fellow Rtists, potentially learn more about the ggplot2 system and showcase your inner creativity!
Please note that the registrants are expected to be proficient in R and some knowledge of tidyverse or ggplot2 as we do not have time to cover the basics in this workshop. Participants are expected also to bring their own laptops with R installed.

title: 2024 Du Bois Challenge using R
description: The 2024 10 week Du Bois Visualisation challenge ended in April with participants contributing their recreations of W.E.B. Du Bois's 1900 Paris Exposition charts. The challenge's goal is to recreate Du Bois's charts using modern tools like Tableau, PowerBi and D3 by Observable. This talk will look at how Simisani Ndaba used R to recreate this year's challenge's charts.

title: How groups manage conflict: Sequence Analysis using TraMineR
description:
We are happy to welcome **Ay≈üeg√ºl Engin** to present how she is using R and in particular the TraMineR package in her research on model-driven decision support. She will present ***How groups manage conflict when using model-driven decision support: Sequence Analysis using TraMineR***, shared work with L. Alberto Franco and Eti√´nne A.J.A. Rouwette.

Following the presentation we are happy to invite you to a small **buffet** and some **drinks**, sponsored by the University of Vienna.

**Abstract**:
*Within and across organisations, groups are formed to tackle situations that require a decision or recommendation to be made, whether the situation is simple or complex, routine or one-off, short or long-term. However, inconsistencies between group members‚Äô definitions of the situation often gives rise to conflict. Within the management and system sciences, various model-driven support approaches have been developed to assist groups in revealing disagreements and managing conflict. In this study, we investigate whether the preference for deliberate and deep information processing, also known as epistemic motivation, affects an important feature of model-driven group decision support. It serves as an aid to surface and manage cognitive conflict within the group. We report on an experimental study that adopts a process-oriented methodology to examine conflict management behaviors and trajectories of groups with different levels of epistemic motivation. Using TraMineR: Sequence Analysis Toolkit, we show how conflict management trajectories are influenced by epistemic motivation of groups. The results indicate that three dimensions of epistemic motivation; discomfort with ambiguity, decisiveness, preference for order and structure are significant co-variates of variance in groups‚Äô conflict management trajectories.*

title: R in Production: An Evening with Hadley Wickham
description:
Join us in partnership with [R-Ladies NYC](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-newyork/) for an enlightening evening with [Hadley Wickham](https://hadley.nz/) as we explore the realm of **"R in Production."**

**Agenda:**

* **6:00 PM CET / 12:00 PM EDT Networking with R-Ladies Rome & NYC**
* **7:00 PM CET / 1:00 PM EDT Dr. Hadley Wickham's Talk + Q&A**

"This talk will discuss what it means to put R *"in production"*. This isn't something you'll necessarily encounter early in your data science journey, but it's useful to have a strong mental model in place for when you inevitably face it. I'll discuss the three principles that I've found useful for distinguishing production for regular analyses:

**Not just once:** Successful data science projects are not a one-off, but will be run repeatedly for months or years. I'll discuss some of the challenges for creating R scripts and applications that run repeatedly, handle new data seamlessly, and adapt to evolving analytical requirements without constant manual intervention.

**Not just my computer:** the transition from development on your laptop (usually windows or mac) to a production environment (usually linux) introduces a number of challenges. Here, I'll discuss some strategies for making R code portable, how you can minimise pain when something inevitably goes wrong, and few unresolved auth challenges that we're currently working on.

**Not just me:** R is not just a tool for individual analysts but a platform for collaboration. I'll cover some of the best practices for writing readable, understandable code, and how you might go about sharing that code with your colleagues." - *[Hadley Wickham](https://hadley.nz/)*

In this engaging event, Hadley, renowned Chief Scientist at Positi PBC (former RStudio), will guide us into the practical applications and best practices for deploying R solutions in real-world production environments. From effective code structuring to ensuring scalability and reliability, Hadley will share invaluable insights and actionable tips for harnessing the full potential of R in production settings.

Whether you're a seasoned data scientist or just beginning your journey with R, this event promises to equip you with the knowledge and tools needed to successfully deploy R solutions and drive impactful outcomes in your organization.

title: let‚Äòs GIT to it
description:
What if you could turn back time? With git, an open source software for version control, you can do that - at least for your code, should the need arise.

In our next workshop, Dominique and Nicolas from ipt (https://ipt.ch/) will teach you how to use git to version control your code, and to effectively collaborate with others on that code.

**Workshop Preparation:**
No previous experience with git required. Please bring a (charged) laptop with the following components installed:

* Git ([Download Git](https://git-scm.com/downloads)): Download and install Git, making a note of where on your computer you install it.
* R ([Download R](https://cloud.r-project.org/)): Download and Install R (if not already installed).
* RStudio ([Download RStudio Desktop](https://www.rstudio.com/products/RStudio/#Desktop)): Download and Install RStudio (if not already installed)
* GitHub account: On [GitHub](https://github.com/) create yourself a free GitHub account.

(Source:[https://www.geo.uzh.ch](https://www.geo.uzh.ch/microsite/reproducible_research/post/rr-rstudio-git/))

If you would like some help installing, use the time slot from 17:30 - 18:00. We are happy to help you out!

During the workshop, you will be asked to work with the following repository: https://github.com/iptch/2023-03-git-techbier

**Program:**
17:30 - 18:00 possibility to get support for installing RStudio and git
18:00 - 18:10 welcome and ice-breaker questions
18:15 - 20:15 workshop
20:15 onwards: socializing & sponsored ap√©ro

**Location:**
Raum SI 122
KV Business School Z√ºrich AG
Bildungszentrum Sihlpost
Sihlpostgasse 2
8004 Z√ºrich

We are very excited to be able to host this workshop for you together with ipt, and we look forward to chatting to you after the event at the ap√©ro!
Seraphina, C√©line, Luisa

title: R-Ladies Monthly Happy Hour
description:
Join R-Ladies Seattle for our monthly happy hour! Come and network with local R-Ladies to make new connections and discuss all things R. This is a casual event so you can stop by any time. You'll find us by our logo (and probably Kim's rainbow hair).

Chips and salsa provided!

Non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab.

title: Reproducible book club #11
description:
This is the 11th meeting of our book club where we are working through, chapter by chapter, the wonderful book by Bruno Rodrigues, [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/).
In this meeting, Angelica Becerra, Data Scientist at Cynkra, will guide us through [Chapter 15](https://raps-with-r.dev/ci_cd.html). We'll learn about CI/CD and how you can leverage GitHub Actions for it.
This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Women in Mathematics Day at ANU: market day stall needs staff
description: Women in Mathematics Day ([May12](https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmay12.womeninmaths.org%2F&data=05%7C02%7Calice.richardson%40anu.edu.au%7C2592de32c4d94b1b211908dc6cc5b8a8%7Ce37d725cab5c46249ae5f0533e486437%7C0%7C0%7C638504843672203376%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=GROKWD19ZNxhEBC75SlbhGyydsuCBRG1ORO9dwGPcH8%3D&reserved=0)) is celebrated on May 12 each year, but this year at ANU the main events will take place on Monday 13 May (: [https://maths.anu.edu.au/news-events/events/may12-celebrating-women-mathematics](https://maths.anu.edu.au/news-events/events/may12-celebrating-women-mathematics)). R-Ladies Canberra has taken up the offer of a stall at the market day session in the afternoon. We are looking for a couple of ANU-based R-Ladies to come along for all or part of that time to meet the participants in a market and explain what a great organisation R-Ladies is! We did send out an email about this but now that time is short, we've created this event to bring it back to your attention. Please RSVP if you are able to help out, even for a short time. Hope to see you there!

title: Back to basics: chart makeover
description: Sarah will present three charts and discuss how they can be improved to tell a stronger story by changing chart type, axes, and labels, and dodging common information design pitfalls.

title: Kratka ali slatka uvodna R radionica
description:
Jesi li uvijek bila znati≈æeljna u vezi R-a, ali te programiranje pomalo pla≈°i? Pridru≈æi nam se 10.05. u 12 sati!

Na ovoj kratkoj, ali slatkoj R-adionici, pokrit ƒáemo osnove R-a, tidyversa i vizualizacije podataka. Radionica je osmi≈°ljena kako bi novim korisnicima pru≈æila samopouzdanje u osnovno kori≈°tenje R-a i motivaciju za nastavak samostalnog uƒçenja. Radionica ne pretpostavlja prethodno iskustvo s R-om ili programiranjem.

title: Reproducible book club #10

In this meeting, our colleague at UiB, Sehee Rim, MD, PhD fellow, will guide us through [Chapter 14](https://raps-with-r.dev/repro_cont.html). We'll learn about Docker and how containers are designed to help with reproducibility.
This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Actions to increase diversity in the R-Ladies community -  S√£o Paulo
description:
Hello friends! We are excited to announce our first international speaker of the year: Beatriz Milz from R-Ladies S√£o Paulo chapter in Brazil. She will be sharing the R-Ladies S√£o Paulo stories and their journey to increase diversity in their community.

This presentation aims to share the diversity issues in the R-Ladies S√£o Paulo community and the actions being taken to increase diversity. The idea is to present some important concepts, such as intersectionality, and discuss the importance of understanding the local context. Also, I drew some reflections that can be useful for thinking about what actions we can take in different R-Ladies chapters to seek to improve diversity.

Based in this post: https://rladies.org/blog/2023-06-05-increasing-diversity-sao-paulo/

title: Getting Started with Quarto for R
description:
We are so excited to have Rika Gorn join us at Rladies NYC for an introduction to Quarto using R.

In our previous meetup ("Level Up Your Docs") we heard from many of you that you had either never used or little experience with Quarto and/or Rmarkdown. Thus, we have invited Rika here to give us an introduction to Quarto and the beautiful documents you can create using Quarto + R.

title: Introduction to R
description:
Do you want to work with R but have no idea where to start? Are you intimidated by the idea of learning a programming language? Have you always been interested in R but found the amount of online resources overwhelming?

R-ladies Amsterdam is hosting a beginner's event to give you a gentle introduction to the R programming language. This event will be an in-person workshop at the University of Amsterdam. We will explain some basic concepts of R and run code together. You get the opportunity to ask questions and work together with other people who are learning R. We will also provide some snacks :)

Itinerary:
18.30 - 18.45 Welcome
18.45 - 20.30 Workshop
20.30 - 21.00 Networking

We kindly ask you to bring your own laptop and install R and RStudio before you arrive! You can find instructions on how to do so here: [https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)

title: RYouWithMe?
description:
Come join us for a **hands-on session on the basics of R and Rstudio**!

This month we keep going with the *"*VizWhiz‚Äù*"* modules of ***RYouWithMe,*** a series of online learning resources for using R - designed by us, for us.

The series is oriented towards R beginners and aims to provide a foundation for future RLadies Sydney activities.

You can start going through the Modules on your own and join us for questions, help and troubleshooting during the meetup.

Find it here: [https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/](https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/)

**How to get involved!**

As an R-Lady learner based in Sydney:

1. Join the R-Ladies Sydney Slack workspace ***[here](https://join.slack.com/t/rladies-sydney/shared_invite/zt-2czd4i8jq-qKuml1FeCHaJPuaYkRDXHQ)***;
2. Introduce yourself in the *#ryouwithme_intros_2024 channel*;
3. Keep an eye out in the *#ryouwithme_general_2024* channel for announcements;
4. Share your successes, ask questions, help out your peers in the *#ryouwithme_help_2024*.
5.

Bring your laptop!

***R-Ladies Sydney organisers***
***Thank you Nous Group for supporting the RLadies!***
*Find us on Twitter @rladiessydney for more information on news, presentations and code!*

This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.\*
***Code of Conduct***\*: R-Ladies Sydney is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*

title: Modelos Aditivos Generalizados
description:
**Se viene un nuevo Meetup VIRTUAL! Organizado por R-Ladies Buenos Aires y R-Ladies Ushuaia. title: Modelos Aditivos Generalizados en R
description:
**¬°Se viene un nuevo Meetup VIRTUAL!** Organizado por **[R-Ladies Buenos Aires](https://rladiesba.netlify.app/) y [R-Ladies Ushuaia](https://twitter.com/RLadiesUshuaia).** En esta oportunidad **Mar√≠a Victoria Quiroga** nos acompa√±a para contarte todo lo que necesitas saber sobre **Modelos Aditivos Generalizados (GAM‚Äôs), u**na soluci√≥n ideal para modelar datos que se generan mediante la suma de diferentes componentes (como descomponer series temporales, descomponer la variabilidad espacial en diferentes componentes, diferentes componentes que representan diferentes fuentes de variabilidad, entre otros).

Para sacarle provecho al meetup es conveniente tener un conocimiento b√°sico de R y estad√≠sticas descriptivas y necesitar√°s los siguientes paquetes: mgcv, ggplot2, itsadug, data.table, car, grid y lubridate.

Finalmente, te invitamos a compartir el link al meetup para quien quiera inscribirse. Por favor, para preservar el evento te pedimos que **no compartas el link de zoom por fuera de las asistentes inscriptas**.

title: Data Challenge Solution Showcase
description:
International Women‚Äôs Day took place on March 8th, 2024. The theme for this year was ‚ÄúInvest in women: Accelerate progress‚Äù.

In honour of this theme, R-Ladies Ottawa hosted **a month-long data challenge!** You can find the [full details](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd) on our website.

Join us to celebrate the hard work of those who participated in the challenge!

Tune in on April 30th for a fun and casual solution showcase where several participants will share their submission, inspiration, and/or cool data-driven insights from the 2024 IWD data challenge.

You can read about all our submissions on [our website](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd.html#submissions).

title: Venez nous rencontrer √† Paris pour une soir√©e d‚Äôapprentissage et d‚Äô√©change
description:
Nous sommes ravis de vous convier √† notre prochain √©v√©nement. Nous aurons le plaisir d‚Äôaccueillir en personne Mar√≠a Paula Caldas et Julie Aubert, le 29 avril 2024 √† partir de 19h dans les locaux de datacraft ([https://datacraft.paris/](https://datacraft.paris/)) situ√©s au 3 Rue Rossini, 75009 Paris. Vous pouvez trouver l'adresse sur Google Maps √† cette adresse : [https://maps.app.goo.gl/1VKXWyhF157xr5Qx6](https://maps.app.goo.gl/1VKXWyhF157xr5Qx6).

Le programme de l‚Äô√©v√©nement est le suivant :

**19h - 19h05 :** Introduction de la communaut√© R-Ladies Paris
**19h05 - 19h35 :** ¬´ Cr√©ation des packages dans R ¬ª, Mar√≠a Paula Caldas
**19h35 - 20h05 :** ¬´ D√©veloppement pratique des mod√®les d‚Äôapprentissage statistique avec {Tidymodels} ¬ª, Julie Aubert
**20h05 - 20h10 :** Mot de cl√¥ture
**20h10 - 20h30 :** R√©ception et √©change entre la communaut√© avec distribution de goodies R

Vous trouverez plus de d√©tails sur nos intervenantes et leurs pr√©sentations ci-dessous.

**Biographie de la premi√®re intervenante :**
Mar√≠a Paula Caldas est une data scientist √† l'OCDE, o√π elle participe √† des projets d'analyse des politiques publiques, de la recherche en √©conomie, et √† la production de statistiques internationales. Utilisatrice de R depuis presque 10 ans, elle s'int√©resse derni√®rement √† l'analyse spatiale, au traitement des donn√©es avec Arrow, et √† la cr√©ation d'√©cosyst√®mes de paquets R pour faciliter le travail en √©quipe. Investie depuis plusieurs ann√©es dans la communaut√© R, Mar√≠a Paula co-anime actuellement le r√©seau d'utilisateurs de R/Python/Git de l'OCDE, et contribue (quand elle peut !) √† des projets communautaires et open source tels que rOpenSci, R-Ladies, r4ds-es et RencontresR.
**Description de l‚Äôintervention :**
Suis-je pr√™te √† cr√©er mon propre paquet ? Quel est l'int√©r√™t si je travaille en solo ? Comment puis-je partager mon paquet avec les autres ? Nous essaierons d'aborder ces questions ensemble, en partageant nos exp√©riences pendant que nous cr√©ons, documentons, testons et partageons un paquet en moins de 30 minutes. Tous les niveaux sont les bienvenus !

**Biographie de la deuxi√®me intervenante :**
Julie Aubert est ing√©nieure de recherche INRAE en statistiques dans l'√©quipe SOLsTIS de l‚Äôunit√© MIA Paris-Saclay. Elle travaille dans le domaine de la mod√©lisation et l‚Äôapprentissage statistique appliqu√©s aux sciences du vivant avec une sp√©cialisation pour les donn√©es omiques en √©cologie microbienne. Dans ce contexte, elle collabore avec des chercheurs issus de domaines aussi vari√©s que l‚Äôagro-√©cologie, la g√©n√©tique des plantes ou des bovins, la gestion des risques en agriculture ou l'alimentation
et d√©veloppe des packages R pour diffuser les m√©thodes propos√©es. Elle anime √©galement le r√©seau StateOftheR du d√©partement MathNum ([https://stateofther.netlify.app/](https://stateofther.netlify.app/)).

**Description de l‚Äôintervention :**
Tidymodels regroupe un ensemble de packages R facilitant l‚Äôutilisation de m√©thodes d‚Äôapprentissage statistique (telles que les for√™ts al√©atoires, les mod√®les lin√©aires ...) dans un cadre unifi√© et ‚Äútidy‚Äù. Dans cette pr√©sentation, nous verrons comment utiliser ces packages pour pr√©traiter les donn√©es, construire, entra√Æner et √©valuer un mod√®le, optimiser des hyperparam√®tres et tout ce qu'il est important de savoir pour mener de bout en bout un projet d‚Äôapprentissage statistique supervis√©.

**Si vous pr√©voyez de participer √† notre √©v√©nement en distanciel,** veuillez vous inscrire via ce formulaire afin de recevoir le lien Zoom **üîó [https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZUrdOuuqD0qG9Vx_WPFSj_5VWVxCmbX9dqm](https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZUrdOuuqD0qG9Vx_WPFSj_5VWVxCmbX9dqm).**

Nous avons h√¢te de vous voir le 29 avril √† Paris ! ü§©

title: Command Line Programming in R
description:
This workshop delves into the world of R programming from the command line interface. It empowers participants to leverage the direct interaction and control offered by the command line, enhancing their R workflow.
The focus will be on:

* **Core functionalities:** Mastering essential R commands for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.
* **Scripting:** Crafting R scripts to automate repetitive tasks and improve reproducibility.
* **Efficiency:** Utilizing the command line for streamlined data exploration and analysis.

By the end of the workshop, attendees will be equipped to:

* Navigate the R command line with confidence.
* Execute core R operations for data management and analysis.
* Construct effective R scripts for automation and efficiency.
* Gain a deeper understanding of the R environment.

This workshop is ideal for those seeking to elevate their R proficiency and unlock the power of command-line programming for data science tasks.

title: Reproducible book club #9
description:
This is the 9th meeting of our book club, where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

In this meeting, Elham Ali will show us how to streamline your analysis using the {targets} package as a workflow manager (based on [chapter 13](https://raps-with-r.dev/targets.html)).

This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Embracing open-source software to implement precision medicine
description:
We are so excited to announce our next virtual meetup, which will serve as a great opportunity to learn how to embrace open-source software to implement precision medicine.

Join us for an exciting talk with Guillaume Desachy - Head of Biometrics, Pierre Fabre, on April 24 at 7 pm CEST.

**Abstract:**
In recent years, the pharmaceutical industry has undergone two significant paradigm shifts, each transforming the landscape of drug development and collaboration.

The first paradigm shift revolves around the implementation of precision medicine, where the concept of biomarkers plays a pivotal role. The term biomarker being widely used, one could think that its meaning is well-understood. But it is not always the case. Actually, what is a biomarker? And why are biomarkers so important?

The second paradigm shift concerns the adoption of programming languages, notably the rise of R alongside traditional tools like SAS. Up until recently, one had to choose between R and SAS. Today, professionals with a quantitative background possess proficiency in at least two programming languages, reflecting the pharmaceutical industry's evolving technological landscape. Community-driven knowledge-sharing has emerged as a cornerstone in navigating these advancements.

With this in mind, I led the development of a community of R users within a big pharma. Over a span of three years, this community experienced exponential growth, expanding from 200 members to 1,600+ members.

In the development of this community, three pivotal questions emerged:

1\. What is the value of your community?
2\. What is a Key Performance Indicator \(KPI\) of your community?
3\. What is the Return On Investment \(ROI\) of your community?

Back in 2022, we were not able to answer these questions, but things changed drastically in 2023!

During this R-Ladies Paris MeetUp, you will hear what the value of a community is, its KPI and its ROI and why building a community is key to drive innovation to bring medicines to patients.

If you are up for joining us, please register for the meetup here üîó https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZEtceCtqz8iHtN-5jDI7Hwi5tUqdKbyPc7u

We are very much looking forward to seeing many of you!

title: Getting started with R
description:
The first workshop by R-Ladies Salzburg.
Speakers: Gabi von Eichhorn & Elisabeth Rothe
This workshop is about getting started with R in Rstudio. We will cover the basic principles of R, including its data structures, data import and basic data wrangling.

When? April 24th, 6:00 pm
Where? Facultas room, NLW Faculty, Hellbrunner Stra√üe 34

R-Ladies events are completely free of charge. We welcome women and underrepresented genders of all R profciency levels interested in learning R, sharing knowledge and networking.

Make sure you read and comply with our code of conduct (https://rladies.org/coc/) and community guidelines (https://guide.rladies.org/about/mission/#r-ladies-rules--guidelines).
Please note that by taking part in an R-Ladies event you grant the community organizers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fundraising or other purposes to help achieve the community's aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organizer.

title: R package Development (in person event)
description:
Our last meetup has been a while, but that is going to change!

Our upcoming meet-up ( a joined event with RLadies Utrecht) is an actual in-person meet in Utrecht! And we have a very special guest: **Jenny Bryan** will be in the Netherlands, and offered to have a talk for us at a meet about R package development. What a wonderful opportunity to meet in person with Jenny and other R-Ladies!

Jenny will be talking about R Package development (https://r-pkgs.org/).

SURF Utrecht kindly offered to host this special occasion. SURF is a cooperative association of Dutch educational and research institutions in which the members work together to acquire or develop the best possible digital services, and to encourage knowledge sharing through continuous innovation ([https://www.surf.nl/en/about](https://www.surf.nl/en/about)). And it is very close to the main train station in Utrecht.

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/).

Come join us in Utrecht!

title: R-Ladies startup meeting! Basic ggplot2 and plotting flowers
description:
The room is S21!

Welcome to the first ever R-Ladies Trondheim event! Since this is our first meeting, and I don't know exatly the audience, I thought I will do a short tutorial for basic use of the R package ggplot2, which is a fantastic tool for data visualization and plotting. As an example of how flexible this package is, I will show how to use ggplot2 to create various flowers! Bring your computer with R and Rstudio installed, and get ready for some spring flowers!

For the workshop, it is an advantage if you are a bit familiar with R, but you do not need to be familiar with ggplot2 from before. If you are not familiar with R and want help installing it on your computer, feel free to come half an hour early, and I can help you with that.

Since this is our first ever meeting, I would also like to set aside some time at the end to chat and discuss any future wishes for what we could use this group for. I look forward to seeing some new faces and seeing what this group can become!

Follow-along code for the meeting: https://github.com/emmaSkarstein/R-Ladies-Trondheim

title: Is ShinyApp in R Production ready?
description:
In a previous Meetup our own Mari Plaza has presented an [introduction of Golem ](https://www.canva.com/design/DAF7twCZcLI/jRhZuTGeiVqHTuPamPV3iw/view?utm_content=DAF7twCZcLI&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=editor)which allows you for sure to write a ShinyApp with the production ready mind-set. That means you write a ShinyApp like a package, including all relevant components of Software Engineering such modules, tests, dependencies, git, code coverage and so on therefore your Web Application developed in R like a ShinyApp has the correct architecture to go to production. This time is not an introduction anymore, it is a **3 hours workshop**, starting with 1 hour presentation about how you plan your application and 2 hours practical experience on how you use Golem.

**Bring your computer** and be ready to ask questions and test by yourself what we are talking about.

Since the content is interesting and dense, you could join us in the preview activities starting at the end of February 2024, but you can always catch-up, even on the day of the event.
The preview activities includes:

* Join our SLACK dedicated channel for discussing the concepts and review related materials.
* Follow posts in our LinkedIn accounts
* Regular updates through the messages of this event on MeetUp.

We are really happy to host this event with care and willingness to learn more about the great world of software engineering.

title: R for geospatial data science and public health surveillance
description:
**üí°Join us as we learn about Geospatial with R**üëáüèª

Geospatial health data are essential to inform public health and policy. These data can be used to understand geographic and temporal patterns, identify risk factors, measure inequalities, and quickly detect outbreaks.

In this talk, **Dr. Moraga** will provide an overview of R packages and statistical methods for geospatial data analysis and health surveillance. She will discuss data biases and availability issues, and present health surveillance applications where R has been used to develop models that can integrate complex data from different sources and resolutions to predict disease risk and identify targets for intervention.

Finally, she will show how R can help with communication and dissemination which is essential to enable broad access to data and to develop and implement appropriate health policies and improve population health globally.

title: Reproducible book club #8
description:
The 7th meeting of our joint book club with [R-Ladies Bergen](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-bergen/) where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

During this meeting, Gabe Winter (R-Ladies Cologne) will show us why testing your code is so essential, what unit tests are, and how you can incorporate it into your developing practices (based on chapter 12).

If you want to try it out, be sure to have RStudio with {rmarkdown} and {knitr} installed.

This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Get to Know the Epidemiologist R Handbook ‚Äì the R Code Reference Manual
description:
We are delighted to announce our next virtual meetup. Join us for an exciting talk with Paulina Jedynak, a Biostatistics and Bioinformatics Postdoctoral Researcher at the Barcelona Institute of Global Health ISGlobal, on April 11 at 7 pm CEST. Paulina will present The Epidemiologist R Handbook, a great resource for learning both R and epidemiology/stats concepts for both complete beginners and advanced R users.

**Description:**

**The Epidemiologist R Handbook** ([https://epirhandbook.com](https://epirhandbook.com)) is an open-access R reference manual for applied epidemiologists and public health practitioners, available in eight languages and used 2.1 million times by 650,000 people so far. It is a comprehensive resource designed to assist in using R for data analysis, visualization, and interpretation, suitable for people very new to R but also for experienced R users, looking for best practices and tips. In order to make it accessible and user-friendly, each of its 50 chapters is accompanied by clear explanations and step-by-step instructions, with brief examples that address common epidemiological problems. The Handbook covers a wide range of topics, including transitioning to R from other software, data import and export, cleaning and management, working with dates and ‚Äòepiweeks‚Äô, generating epidemic curves, performing survival analysis, using basic statistical methods applied to epidemiology, etc.
The Epidemiologist R Handbook is produced by an independent collaboration of epidemiologists and it is hosted and curated by the [Applied Epi](https://www.appliedepi.org/) ‚Äì a nonprofit organization and grassroots movement of frontline epis from around the world, aiming to strengthen epidemiological practice through training, tools, and support. The organization delivers practical R training courses to over 350 public health agencies worldwide and hosts the [Applied Epi Community](https://community.appliedepi.org/) with a Q&A forum for R code and public health practice.

If you are up for joining us, please register for the meetup here üîó https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZwud-CgqD8rGdfm8rRU7Rq6pEvRNTv3_F16#/registration

We are very much looking forward to seeing many of you!

description:

title: Data Challenge 2024
description:
*Please note: You don't need to have attended the [kickoff event](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-ottawa/events/299173960/) to participate! Anyone can participate!*

International Women‚Äôs Day took place on March 8th, 2024. The theme for this year is ‚ÄúInvest in women: Accelerate progress‚Äù.

In honour of this theme, R-Ladies Ottawa is hosting **a month-long data challenge!**

You can find the [full details](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd) on our website.

**Challenge**

The objective of this data challenge is to analyze *investing in women*. This is a very open-ended challenge, so be as creative as you‚Äôd like!

Some examples include:

* Analyze venture capital investment data to understand trends in funding for women-led startups.
* Analyze businesses or organizations that promote women‚Äôs empowerment.
* Analyze data on gender diversity in leadership positions.

You can use any data source, but the following are examples:

* [Measuring the value of women‚Äôs contribution to the Canadian economy: New insights based on recent work](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/36-28-0001/2023002/article/00001-eng.htm)
* [Statistics Canada‚Äôs ](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/topics-start/gender_diversity_and_inclusion)*[Gender, Diversity and Inclusion Statistics Hub](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/topics-start/gender_diversity_and_inclusion)*
* [Statistics Canada‚Äôs ](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/t1/tbl1/en/tv.action?pid=3310066001)*[Average percentage of women and men in management positions](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/t1/tbl1/en/tv.action?pid=3310066001)*[ tables](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/t1/tbl1/en/tv.action?pid=3310066001)

**Guidelines**

Although this challenge is hosted by *R-Ladies* Ottawa, you don‚Äôt have to use R to participate. You could use R, Python, a combination of the two, or anything you‚Äôre comfortable with!

No previous programming experience is required! If you‚Äôre interested in participating, but aren‚Äôt sure where to start, check out the recordings from our [Introduction to R workshops](https://rladies-ottawa.gitub.io/events/2024/intro_to_r.html) that we hosted in early 2024. The workshops will give you a solid foundation in data analysis and data visualization using R.

While anyone is welcome to participate in the challenge and submit an entry, **only submissions by women and gender minorities who reside in Canada will be eligible for the prizes.**

**Prizes**

You can participate individually, or in teams of up to 5 people!
Prize details will be released at a later date.

**How to submit an entry**

This will be a month-long data challenge, and you‚Äôll have until **April 7th** to submit your entry. Your submission can be in any form you like ‚Äì it can be a Quarto document, an image, a link to a webpage, or a link to a video, for example.

There are two options for submitting an entry:

* Option 1 (preferred option): If you have experience with GitHub and Quarto, you can create a pull request on [this repository](https://github.com/RLadies-Ottawa/rladies-ottawa.github.io) and add your submission to the [‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd.html#submissions) part of [this page](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd)
* Option 2: If you don‚Äôt have experience with GitHub, you can email [ottawa@rladies.org](mailto:ottawa@rladies.org) a link to your submission materials and we will add the link to the [‚ÄúSubmissions‚Äù](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd.html#submissions) part of [this page](https://rladies-ottawa.github.io/events/2024/iwd)

**Submitting an entry**

After the submission deadline, R-Ladies Ottawa will host a virtual event where participants can showcase their work. This is a great way to learn from one another and to connect with other like-minded individuals!

The date and time of the showcase event will be announced soon.
