title: Good (Enough) Practices for Scientific Reproducibility
description:
**Good Enough Practices for Scientific Reproducibility**

Computational tools are making it easier than ever to collect, analyze, and share data and results in transparent and reproducible ways. But‚Ä¶ how do we achieve this desired reproducibility?

Join us at our next Meetup on **April 3 from 6:00 to 7:30 pm**, in person at NCEAS, where Colleen Smith and Camila Vargas Poulsen will share Good (Enough) Practices for Achieving Scientific Reproducibility. Through this presentation, the speakers will discuss tools and systems to help you organize and document your work for better reproducibility. We will discuss why aiming for reproducibility is important yet challenging and how these systems can help you make your work more robust and facilitate collaboration (including with yourself).

**About the speakers**
Colleen Smith is a biologist with the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, where she writes recovery plans for endangered species. Before that, she spent 9 years in academia, where she analyzed many different types of datasets to investigate how bee biodiversity is responding to global change. In her spare time she likes to run, hike and spend as much time outdoors with her dog Otto as she can.

Camila Vargas Poulsen is the Data Training Coordinator at the NCEAS Learning Hub, where she manages, maintains, and develops the NCEAS data science training portfolio. She also leads data science courses like coreR and a range of modular training for scientists who want to integrate data science tools into their analytical workflow. Outside work, you can find Camila in, next to, or on the ocean and cooking family-style dinners with friends.

title: RYouWithMe?
description:

This month we keep going with the *"Clean it up"* modules of ***RYouWithMe,*** a series of online learning resources for using R - designed by us, for us.

The series is oriented towards R beginners and aims to provide a foundation for future RLadies Sydney activities.

You can start going through the Modules on your own and join us for questions, help and troubleshooting during the meetup.

Find it here: [https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/](https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/)

**How to get involved!**

2. Introduce yourself in the *#ryouwithme_intros_2024 channel*;
3. Keep an eye out in the *#ryouwithme_general_2024* channel for announcements;

Bring your laptop!

title: Toronto R-Ladies is back: Lightning Talks!
description:
Toronto R-Ladies is back with an evening of lightning talks and networking! We're excited to learn from 5-minute lightning talks delivered by some of the fantastic R-Ladies in our community, followed by time for connecting and networking!

**Talks and speakers:**

A Stream of Consciousness: Using ggplot2 to visualize how we move through thoughts - Riya Trikha
EveRything in its right visual place - Charlotte Leferink
Automating PowerPoint slide decks with the officeverse - Jenny Rieck
Wastewater Surveillance Laboratory Proficiency - Jane Ho
Mastering Randomness: Setting Seed in R - Wendy Graham

Doors will open at 6pm with introductions and talks around 6:15pm. Everything will conclude at 8. Please join us!All attendees agree to abide by the R-Ladies Code of Conduct ([https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct](https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct)).

title: R-Ladies Book Club - In Person Only
description:
For our March book club, we are reading "[Breaking Barriers: Celebrating Women and Diversity in Data Science](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CH25NFW6?ref_=cm_sw_r_cp_ud_dp_EDZ33FCSZH26SWW04W2Q)" by Zeyneb Kay and Shivani Mudhol. This is a short read - only 75 pages - but you don't have to read all of it to join the discussion!

The book is also available for purchase for about $5.

Don't forget to post your questions or reactions on our #rladies_bookclub Slack channel! Not part of our Slack? No problem! Fill out [this form](https://forms.gle/tK4ek5XbN7gLKRJU6) to request an invite.

***

We are happy to have this event be live and in person! This event will be held in person at Brookfield Place by the palm trees in the atrium. The address is 230 Vesey St, New York, NY 10281.

***

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the [R-Ladies Global code of conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct) (particularly if this is your first time attending!):

title: Role of R in Data Science (2 days)   venue detail will be mailed .
description: We'll discover what data science is. Data science applications for the R language. We'll also talk about a few common misconceptions around data science.

title: Getting involved with R-Ladies
description:

This event will be held in English.

title: R-Ladies Amsterdam Relaunch
description:
After a hiatus due to COVID-19, R-ladies Amsterdam is back with new organisers! At this Relaunch event, members will meet the new organisers, network with each other, and share ideas for future workshops. Space is limited, so sign up! Below is a tentative event agenda.

Welcome 18:30 - 18:45
Introductions 18:45 - 19:00
Getting to know each other 19:00 - 19:20
Group discussion of ideas for future workshops and events 19:20 - 20:00
Networking 20:00 - 20:30

Norstat has kindly offered to host our relaunch event. Norstat is one of the leading data collectors for market research in Europe. Their mission is to deliver trustworthy data of the highest quality to enable well-informed analysis and decision-making ([https://norstat.co/company/](https://norstat.co/company/)).
R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. See the [code of conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/).

title: International Women‚Äôs Day 2024 | Impact the Future
description:
To all women in tech, come and celebrate with us the International Women's Day meetup PARTY! A collaboration of data science meetups in the Greater Seattle area.

To all our allies, this is a women event and is inclusive and everyone is welcome to attend.

Our vision is to build economic opportunity for women through technology. Our programs provide visibility, community, and resources for women in technology.

We all have the power and the responsibility to impact the future of technology and society, with AI as a major part of shaping our world. What will that future look like? And how will we build it? We can use our skills, creativity and passion to create positive change and solve the problems that matter to us and our communities. We can also inspire the next generation of women in tech who will continue to impact the future with their own ideas and innovations.

An event for our local tech community, with a strong focus on knowledge exchange, networking, and learning. Get together with [RLadies Seattle](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-seattle/), [Seattle Spark + AI](https://www.linkedin.com/company/seattle-spark-ai/), [PyLadies Seattle](https://www.linkedin.com/company/pyladies-seattle/), [GDG Bellevue](https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-bellevue), [PyData Seattle](https://www.linkedin.com/company/pydata-seattle/), and [Women Techmakers Seattle](https://www.linkedin.com/company/wtmseattle), [Seattle Artificial Intelligence Workshops](https://www.meetup.com/seattle-artificial-intelligence-workshops/)

Event program:

* 6:00 - 6:30 - Candy üç≠üç¨ eat, beverages, swag and network - Donated by [Databricks](https://www.databricks.com/) and [Delta Lake](https://delta.io/) üçøüçî Hamburguers, Fried Chicken, Tamales, Cuban Sandwich!
* 6:30 - 6:40 - Announcements

We recommend to arrive early as seats are limited and are first come first serve.

title: R-Ladies Denver Relaunch: fusen, litr, and readme2pkg discussion
description:
Denver RLadies is rebooting! Our upcoming hybrid meeting will focus on new tools that take a ‚Äòliterate programming‚Äô approach to package building.

As more people get into R package development, some have noticed that the ‚Äòpackage story‚Äô can get lost. R packages are composed of many files. But these multiple, un-ordered constituents may yield an unclear big-picture package narrative.

Our meeting will bring together like-minded thinkers and tool creators in this space, authors of the [{litr}](https://jacobbien.github.io/litr-project/index.html), [{fusen}](https://github.com/Thinkr-open/fusen/), and [{readme2pkg}](https://github.com/EvaMaeRey/readme2pkg.template) packages. Each of these tools is motivated by keeping the package creation narrative in one place (an Rmarkdown file). But implementations are different. Our meeting will allow for a comparative look at these approaches and illuminate similarities and differences.

Presenters:
Gina Reynolds: [{readme2pkg}](https://github.com/EvaMaeRey/readme2pkg.template)
Jacob Bien: [{litr}](https://jacobbien.github.io/litr-project/index.html)
S√©bastien Rochette: [{fusen}](https://github.com/Thinkr-open/fusen/)

R-Ladies [Code of Conduct](https://rladies.org/coc/)

title: CAREERS IN DATA SCIENCE AND STATISTICS
description:
Welcome to our first event of the year!

This event will showcase a panel of experts and discuss the different journeys that brought them to their current role in data science and statistics.

Doors will open at 5.30pm with pizza, drinks and networking. The panel discussion will start at 6pm.

**Professor Di Cook**
Dianne Cook is Professor of Business Analytics at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. Her research is in the area of data visualisation, especially the visualisation of high-dimensional data using [tours](https://github.com/ggobi/tourr) with low-dimensional projections, and projection pursuit. A current focus is on bridging the gap between [exploratory graphics and statistical inference](http://dicook.github.io/nullabor/). Technology plays an important role in data visualisation for evaluating effectiveness and for public consumption. Di utilises technology such as virtual environments, Amazon‚Äôs Mechanical Turk, and eye-tracking in her work, and makes an effort to share her work with open source software. Di is a Fellow of the [American Statistical Association](https://www.amstat.org/), elected member of the [International Statistical Institute](https://isi-web.org/), past-editor of the [Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics](http://amstat.tandfonline.com/toc/ucgs20/current), elected Member of the [R Foundation](https://www.r-project.org/foundation/), and current editor of the [R Journal](https://journal.r-project.org/). Education is an important part of her contributions, and mentoring graduate research is a significant activity. Several of her students have won the prestigious American Statistical Association John Chambers Software Award, including Hadley Wickham, Yihui Xie, Carson Sievert, and most recently, Monash student Earo Wang.

**Dr. Lauren Smith**
Lauren is a Postdoctoral Fellow in Infectious Disease Modelling at WEHI. Lauren has a broad range of interests spanning across One Health, human/veterinary/wildlife epidemiology, infectious disease and population dynamics modelling, and statistical analysis. Lauren currently works on projects relating to the control of infectious diseases in the Asia-Pacific region, including the development of diagnostic tools to identify individuals recently infected with Plasmodium vivax. In her previous research, she has addressed questions related to the management of animal populations and infectious diseases, and the welfare of domestic animals. This has included using statistical and mathematical models to assess the effectiveness of free-roaming dog population management, rabies control strategies, canine distemper virus dynamics, African swine fever in domestic pigs, and cetacean ecology and conservation.

**Dr. Mun Hua Tan**
Mun Hua is experienced in genomics and bioinformatics, with a hybrid repertoire of wet- and dry-lab skills. She is currently a postdoctoral researcher in the Day Lab at the University of Melbourne, focusing on malaria surveillance and antigenic diversity in natural parasite populations. Mun Hua holds a PhD in Life and Environmental Sciences and a Bachelor of Science in Biotechnology. Her areas of expertise include genome assemblies and annotation, variant calling, phylogenetics, genetics, data processing, and data visualisation. Mun Hua‚Äôs professional journey has included work experience in academic research, genomics centres, and industry, on a breadth of biological systems. She enjoys working in interdisciplinary collaborations, where she frequently navigates the intersection between biology and computational analysis.

**Evie Gizem**
Evie has extensive experience working in data science and analytics teams on various projects in the education sector, research, and government. Currently she is a Lead Data Analyst at RMIT, working in the Data & Analytics team. Evie holds a Master of Analytics degree from RMIT and a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics. Her areas of expertise include statistical modelling, machine learning techniques, data processing, programming, and data visualisation. Evie is passionate about effectively communicating data science concepts and provides guidance to both internal and external clients on data science strategies, utilising cutting-edge tools and approaches. She also evaluates the feasibility of data science projects to ensure practical outcomes are achieved.

**Dr. G√∂knur Giner**
G√∂knur Giner is a bioinformatician at WEHI. She has been using her statistical and machine learning skills to develop new bioinformatics methods needed for advancing genomic data analysis. In particular, she has been working to better understand the origins of the most invasive forms of breast cancer and to understand cancer metastasis. She has extensive experience working with and developing tools for genomic technologies, such as RNA sequencing, whole-exome sequencing, CRISPR/Cas9, microarray; and experiments conducted with circulating tumor cells, patient-derived xenografts.

See you there !

title: A Tutorial On Linear Regression
description:
Join us at our R- Ladies Chennai virtual meetup for a fun event of networking and learning R. Newbies are welcome too! During this meetup, we are excited to help you learn linear regression.

About the session: In this session, we will analyze a dataset using linear regression to explore the relationship between a response variable and explanatory variables which may be categorical or numerical. We will also quantify the fit of models and learn about outliers, leverage and influence.

title: From Complex to Clear: Understanding Your NLP Models
description:
**Abstract**
When training and evaluating machine learning models, it is important to understand why the model made its decision the way it did. This is what explainable machine learning is all about.
By providing an understanding of modern large language models and how they work, I will explain why explainable machine learning is an essential core part of any model development and evaluation pipeline.

This workshop aims to provide practitioners with practical insights, offering a toolbox of approaches to improve their understanding of models and lift the veil on these seemingly opaque "black box" models.

Throughout the workshop, we will be using an open-source model as a working example and accessing it through the popular framework huggingface. While the common frameworks are based on Python, I will show you how to use the best of both worlds and mix and match Python code chunks with R to learn more about your model.

title: Extending the data science workflow: {vetiver} and {pins}
description: Data practitioners possess a robust skill set in data analysis and model development. However, there's often a gap in understanding tasks beyond the conventional data science workflow, like deploying models as API endpoints or monitoring model decay. In this session, we'll delve into the fundamentals of machine learning operations (MLOps) tasks, leveraging the vetiver and pins packages. Our emphasis will be on exploring various real-world scenarios, good and bad, where these tools can be instrumental in solving practical challenges.

title: Database-ics: an introduction to SQL for R users
description:
As R users, we often read in data directly from files, such as .csv files. However, developing an understanding of SQL gives us an edge when working with big data, as we can connect to databases directly from R, pulling in only the bits that we need for analysis and saving memory. SQL can also be used to efficiently perform simple data manipulation tasks like sorting, filtering, and aggregation on large datasets, which would take significant computational resources in R.

In this RLadies workshop we will run through some basic SQL queries that can be used to retrieve and filter tables from databases, and learn a little bit about how relational databases work. We will then look at how to write and run SQL queries directly from R, and some use cases for this.

In order to fully participate in this workshop, please make sure you have R and RStudio installed on your laptop, and make sure you have the package ‚ÄòDBI‚Äô installed by running \`install.packages("DBI")\` before the workshop. We will use this package to connect to a SQL database via R.

After the workshop, we will have ample time for networking and chatting over some snacks and drinks (courtesy of the Software Sustainability Institute).

Chloe Brook is a Data Science Applications Consultant at EPCC, University of Edinburgh. Having studied Biochemistry at university, she is keen to enthuse others who haven‚Äôt come directly from computer science backgrounds about the joys of coding and data. She is also an online tutor alongside her day job, and enjoys encouraging people to believe in their ability to learn and grow!

title: Statistics, Epidemiology, Team (Data) Science: Wastewater Surveillance (Virtual)
description:
## Details

R-Ladies Irvine ([https://www.rladiesirvine.org/](https://www.rladiesirvine.org/)) is very excited to host this virtual meeting on Tuesday, March 19, 2024 from 4:30-6 pm PDT!! The two speakers, Professor Katherine Ensor and Dr. Julia Schedler, are affiliated with Houston Wastewater Epidemiology (link [https://hou-wastewater-epi.org/](https://hou-wastewater-epi.org/)) and the Department of Statistics at Rice University. Professor Ensor will illustrate how Spatial-Temporal Modeling is applied to Public Health Surveillance through Wastewater and Dr. Schedler will share three stories about Reproducibility in Team Science.

**Spatial-Temporal Modeling is applied to Public Health Surveillance through Wastewater**
Wastewater surveillance has emerged as a strong tool for city, county, state, and national public health departments. By examining SARS-CoV-2 RNA viral load, wastewater provides a strong signal of the extent of the virus in a community. Measuring and modeling the evolution of the virus in a community is however fraught with many complexities. In this talk, I will explore the spatio-temporal modeling based on weekly observations of a mix of measurements across sewersheds of differing scales and localized lift stations. We will use adaptive temporal methods and the extended Hausdorff distance for spatial correlations of regions of vastly different shapes and serving different sized communities. Examining this case study in the context of statistical engineering and problem-solving, I will highlight some of the challenges and benefits of partnerships between universities and local governments.

**Three Stories About Reproducibility in Team Science**
Some statisticians and data scientists may imagine an ideal world where every scientific manuscript is accompanied by fully documented data sets and all code used to generate all included figures, tables, and numerical results. In the real world, there are many barriers to this ideal, for example, privacy concerns, time and staff constraints, differences in data science workflows, and statisticians getting excited about reproducibility and overwhelming their collaborators. In this talk, I will share three stories about reproducibility from my year working with the scientists and statisticians at Houston Wastewater Epidemiology. The first story will be our journey to learn Quarto to build a rendered vignette website to document the R code accompanying a recent paper and how we incorporated student research assistants into the publication process. The second story will tell the tale of two Shiny apps with the same functionality but drastically different implementations. Finally, I will share how we developed a reproducibility review process for providing feedback on R code written by our group's scientists, drawing on experiences from the business world.

\#\# Schedule
4:30 \- 4:45 pm PDT \| Announcements
4:45 \- 5:45 pm PDT \| Speakers
5:45 \- 6:00 pm PDT \| Questions

En este minitaller, aprenderemos algunas herramientas para leer y/o escribir grandes vol√∫menes de datos con formatos similares, identificar errores de formato y lectura de archivos de datos, leer informaci√≥n de forma eficiente, idear estrategias para limpiar y organizar datos, obtener algunos estad√≠sticos b√°sicos de los datos y realizar graficaciones automatizadas masivas.

title: R-Ladies Honolulu - Meet and Greet, 13 Mar 2024, 06:30 PM
description:
Join us for the inaugural meeting of R-Ladies Honolulu! During this meet and greet, our organizers will introduce themselves and share the mission of R-Ladies. We're eager to learn about your interests and what you hope to gain from our community, and will tailor future events on what we hear from you at this initial meeting.

This event is free and open to the public, up to the RSVP limit, and we welcome all levels of R software practitioners. Whether you're a seasoned professional or completely new to R, we hope to build this community to provide networking opportunities and useful insights. Don't miss the chance to join a supportive community dedicated to promoting gender diversity in the R community.

title: Workshop - Introduction to R - Part 2
description:
To complete topics that we did not manage to fit into the first workshop, we will host the second part of the Introduction to R Workshop in our next Meetup. This time we will cover:

* Reading in data
* Basic data visualization
* R packages
* R Markdown for writing reports

The workshop is **open to everyone**, in particular also if you did not make it to the first part! To catch up you can look at the first few sections of the workshop material prepared by Pia: [Intro to R](https://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://github.com/piapfeiffer/intro-to-R/blob/main/intro_r.html) (up to Data Structures) or you could read through the Getting Started section of [https://moderndive.netlify.app/1-getting-started.html](https://moderndive.netlify.app/1-getting-started.html)

As before, we recommend you **bring your own laptop** where you have R and RStudio installed ([https://cran.r-project.org/](https://cran.r-project.org/) and [https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)). In case you want to install Rmarkdown you can follow the instructions at [https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/installation.html](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/installation.html)

title: So-uporaba R in Python v RStudio
description:
Naslov name pove vse. ≈Ωan nam bo pokazal kako lahko so-uporabljamo R in Python v RStudiu, v eni sami kodi.

Tokrat se ponovno vidimo v ƒçudovitih prostorih Sportradar-ja na Litostrojski 52a!

The title says it all. We will try and see how to use R and Python in the same code (different chunks) in RStudio.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Introduction to RMarkdown and Quarto (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is excited to host a meetup on Tuesday March 12, 2024 from 4-5:30pm (entirely virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have two wonderful presentations from

* Alexis Norris a Bioinformatician at the FDA and Chair of the FDA Omics Working Group (https://twitter.com/AlexisLNorris)
* Isabella Vel√°squez a Senior Product Marketing Manager at Posit (https://ivelasq.rbind.io/about)

They will be giving a series of presentations on RMarkdown and Quarto!

WHO is this for?

* If you are new to R and want to learn about R packages?
* If you know R, but want to expand your knowledge publishing platforms in the R programming language?

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA

* 4:00‚Äì4:15pm Who we are \| Announcements \| What's next
* 4:15‚Äì5 pm Presentation: Introduction to RMarkdown and Quarto
* 5‚Äì5:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:

* The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?

A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:

* If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

title: International Women's Day Networking Event and Data Challenge Kickoff
description:
Join R-Ladies Ottawa for an in-person networking event on International Women's Day at Beyond the Pale! This is a great opportunity to meet other women and gender minorities from the Ottawa area who are interested in open-source. In honour of IWD, we will also be holding a month-long data challenge. We'll announce the details of the data challenge on IWD at this networking event (you don't need to attend the networking event to participate in the data challenge, and vice versa).

**Note: Please RSVP by March 1st, and only RSVP "Yes" if you plan on attending** \-\- this is because we need to provide an accurate estimate of numbers to the venue\. :\)

**Please also note that the mission of R-Ladies is to increase gender diversity in the R community.** Our events are intended to provide a safe space **for women and gender minorities.**

title: International Womens Day lunch
description: International Womens Day on Friday 8 March is all about celebrating women's achievement, raising awareness about discrimination, and taking action to drive gender parity. R-Ladies Canberra will be celebrating IWD with a lunch at Badger & Co, located in Kambri on University Avenue at the ANU campus. Look out for the R-Ladies banner to find us! You can buy your own food and drink, and meet in person with members of Canberra's R-Ladies community. Come along and discuss what sort of activities you'd like to see R-Ladies Canberra offer in 2024, as we aim to re-invigorate the chapter this year.

title: R-Stories: The Role of Gender in Data Collection and Analysis
description:
A day before International Women's Day, we dedicate a **joint event of R-Ladies Z√ºrich and the [Zurich R User Group](https://www.meetup.com/zurich-r-user-group/)** to hearing about experiences and considerations for when collecting and analysing data on gender and diversity.

Join us for an exciting panel discussion moderated by Luisa Barbanti (Zurich Data Scientists), featuring some very interesting guests:

* Luisa Coppola (ABB Schweiz AG)
* Luca M. Leisten (ETH Zurich)
* Almut Scherer (SCQM)
* Christina Seyler (UZH),
* and others.

The event will take place on **March 7th, 2023, 18:30 - 20:00** in room **KOL-E-13 EV** in the main building of the university of Z√ºrich and will be followed by a networking apero.

19:30 - 19:50 Open discussion with audience

We welcome people of all sexual orientations and gender identities and are looking forward to lively discussions!

Last but not least, we ask you to only sign up either through R-Ladies Z√ºrich or the [Zurich R User Group](https://www.meetup.com/zurich-r-user-group/) so that we can avoid double-booking.

title: Reproducible pipelines book club #6
description:
The 6th meeting of our book club where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

During this meeting, Julia Romanowska (co-founder of R-Ladies Bergen) will guide us through [chapter 10](https://raps-with-r.dev/repro_intro.html), where the [{renv}](https://rstudio.github.io/renv/articles/renv.html) package is presented. This chapter teaches how to keep track of various versions of packages one uses during an analysis.

This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

Check the next meetings in this book club and sign up to present one of the chapters that need a presenter.

title: RYouWithMe?
description:
Come join us for a **hands-on session on the basics of R and Rstudio**!

This month we will kick off with the first 3 modules of ***RYouWithMe,*** a series of online learning resources for using R - designed by us, for us. The series is oriented towards R beginners and aims to provide a foundation for future RLadies Sydney activities.

Does opening RStudio make you just want to close it again? Don‚Äôt worry, we are going to start at the VERY beginning: where to find your files, what you might use the console for, and where your script get written. From there, we‚Äôll move on to data wrangling, visualisation, R language, and R Markdown.

Find it here: [https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/](https://rladiessydney.org/courses/ryouwithme/)

**How to get involved!**

As an R-Lady learner based in Sydney:

1. Join the R-Ladies Sydney Slack workspace ***[here](https://join.slack.com/t/rladies-sydney/shared_invite/zt-2czd4i8jq-qKuml1FeCHaJPuaYkRDXHQ)***;
2. Introduce yourself in the *#ryouwithme_intros_2024 channel*;
3. Keep an eye out in the *#ryouwithme_general_2024* channel for announcements;
4. Share your successes, ask questions, help out your peers in the *#ryouwithme_help_2024*.

You can start going through the Modules ***BasicBasics 1,2*** and ***3*** on your own and join us for questions, help and troubleshooting during the meetup.

Bring your laptop!

***R-Ladies Sydney organisers***
***Thank you Nous Group for supporting the RLadies!***
*Find us on Twitter @rladiessydney for more information on news, presentations and code!*
\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
***Photos, Films and all other media/recordings***\*: Photographs and/or video/other media will be taken at events held by this community. By taking part in an R-Ladies Sydney event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community‚Äôs aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.\*
***Code of Conduct***\*: R-Ladies Sydney is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.\*
***Community Policies***\*: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Sydney events to be of minority genders.\*

title: Dataviz lunch: Replicating Du Bois with R
description:
**In light of the ongoing #DuboisChallenge2024, we'll demonstrate how to replicate one of the original plates from W.E.B. Du Bois's legacy at the 1900 Paris Exposition using modern tools such as R.**
**We'll explore the colours used in the plates and delve into the intricacies of the challenge by understanding the perspective of hand-made graphs in the "Duboisian" style.**
**This session can be hands-on or just to watch-learn, depending on your preference. If you‚Äôd like to participate, please make sure your R interface (RStudio, VScode, Posit Cloud) is ready with the latest version installed. Also, a quick look at the #DuboisChallenge2024 GitHub repo for some extra hints would be helpful: [https://github.com/ajstarks/dubois-data-portraits/tree/master/challenge/2024](https://github.com/ajstarks/dubois-data-portraits/tree/master/challenge/2024)**

title: Meetup R-Ladies S√£o Paulo - An√°lise de dados abertos com R - Open Data Day
description:
Esse evento faz parte do Open Data Day (dia dos dados abertos), uma celebra√ß√£o mundial!

O evento acontecer√° no [Insper](https://www.insper.edu.br/pesquisa-e-conhecimento/centro-de-ciencia-de-dados/), e contar√° com palestras curtas (o que √© o Open Data Day? O que s√£o dados abertos? O que √© a Base dos dados? Como usar o R para buscar dados na [Base dos Dados](https://basedosdados.org/)? O que √© a Rede de Embaixadoras de Inova√ß√£o C√≠vica?), e atividades pr√°ticas usando dados extra√≠dos do Base dos Dados.

O evento ser√° similar ao que ocorreu em 2023, e √© poss√≠vel ler o relato neste link: https://rladies-sp.org/posts/2023-03-evento-open-data-day/

Trata-se de de uma atividade pr√°tica de um dia inteiro, gratuita e que n√£o exige conhecimento pr√©vio de R ou outra linguagem de programa√ß√£o.

**P√∫blico-alvo: pessoas que se identificam como minoria de g√™nero (mulher trans ou cis, homem trans, pessoa n√£o-bin√°ria, queer).**

Nesta edi√ß√£o contaremos com um espa√ßo para incentivar a presen√ßa de m√£es em nossos eventos: o **GuGuDaDados!** √â um espa√ßo colaborativo e experimental que as RLadies prop√µem com o objetivo de deixar as crian√ßas entretidas e cuidadas enquanto as pessoas respons√°veis podem se dedicar com tranquilidade √† sua forma√ß√£o. Saiba mais sobre o espa√ßo GuGuDaDados neste post: [https://rladies-sp.org/posts/2023-01-evento-oficina-intro-R/#espa%C3%A7o-gugudadados](https://rladies-sp.org/posts/2023-01-evento-oficina-intro-R/#espa%C3%A7o-gugudadados)

Por favor leia todas as informa√ß√µes abaixo!

‚Ä¢ **O QUE PRECISO FAZER PARA PARTICIPAR?**

* Passo 1: fa√ßa aqui sua pr√© inscri√ß√£o no meetup - voc√™ ficar√° na lista de espera e tudo bem, √© isso mesmo!
* Passo 2: voc√™ dever√° preencher o fomul√°rio: [https://forms.gle/gwk6Bx49THK9a3EJ9 ](https://forms.gle/gwk6Bx49THK9a3EJ9)(que tamb√©m enviaremos por email, ent√£o, nos d√™ seu email ;-)
* Passo 3: esperar! Quando sua inscri√ß√£o for realizada, voc√™ entrar√° na lista de presen√ßa do meetup.
* Passo 4: Voc√™ receber√° um email com o status da sua inscri√ß√£o - cheque seu email com frequ√™ncia!

**Por que estamos fazendo isso?**
*Temos vagas reservadas para pessoas negras e ind√≠genas, vagas reservadas para m√£es e vagas priorit√°rias para minorias de g√™nero.*
*E como nesta plataforma (MeetUp) n√£o conseguimos captar essas informa√ß√µes, estamos experimentando este processo para garantir maior diversidade do nosso p√∫blico alvo.*

‚Ä¢ **O QUE PRECISO FAZER PARA PARTICIPAR?**

* Seguir o passo-a-passo acima
* Ler o c√≥digo de conduta (mais detalhes abaixo)
* Caso seja poss√≠vel, levar seu pr√≥prio notebook - n√£o √© obrigat√≥rio (e, se der, sua pr√≥pria caneca!)
* **Instalar em seu notebook os programas R e RStudio ANTES do curso**: [https://www.curso-r.com/material/instalacao/](https://www.curso-r.com/material/instalacao/)
(Se n√£o conseguir, n√£o se preocupe que te ajudamos no dia!)
* Vontade de aprender R em um ambiente inclusivo, amistoso e seguro :)

‚Ä¢ C√ìDIGO DE CONDUTA (dispon√≠vel aqui: [https://guide.rladies.org/about/coc/#portuguese](https://guide.rladies.org/about/coc/#portuguese))
Qualquer pessoa que violar ou houver previamente violado o c√≥digo de conduta desta comunidade ter√° sua entrada proibida, ser√° expulsa/o e/ou estar√° sujeita/o √† a√ß√£o que a pessoa organizadora achar mais apropriada, independente de inscri√ß√£o no evento, ser membro do MeetUp ou qualquer outra condi√ß√£o.

‚Ä¢ CAF√â COLABORATIVO:

* Iremos fazer um caf√© colaborativo: quem puder levar alguma coisa para comer ou beber durante o dia, pode levar!
* Se poss√≠vel traga sua caneca :D

***

‚Ä¢ APOIO:

* [Centro de Ci√™ncia de Dados - Insper ](https://www.insper.edu.br/pesquisa-e-conhecimento/centro-de-ciencia-de-dados/)(espa√ßo)
* [Base dos dados](https://basedosdados.org/) (atividade)
* [Embaixadoras de Inova√ß√£o C√≠vica - OKBR](https://embaixadoras.ok.org.br/) (parceria e co-organiza√ß√£o)

***

‚Ä¢ SOBRE AS R-LADIES
R-Ladies √© uma organiza√ß√£o que promove a diversidade de g√™nero na comunidade da linguagem R. Nosso principal objetivo √© promover a linguagem computacional estat√≠stica R compartilhando conhecimento, assim, quem tiver interesse na linguagem ser√° bem-vinda, independente do n√≠vel de conhecimento. Nosso principal p√∫blico-alvo s√£o as pessoas que se identificam com o g√™nero feminino, portanto, mulheres cis, mulheres trans, bem como pessoas n√£o-bin√°rias e queer.

***

**O evento √© gratuito, mas as vagas s√£o limitadas. Seja consciente e s√≥ se inscreva se puder comparecer ao evento. Caso se inscreva e tenha alguma intercorr√™ncia que te impe√ßa de ir ao evento basta nos avisar com at√© 1 dia de anteced√™ncia e cancelar sua inscri√ß√£o na plataforma meetup :)**

title: Level Up Your Quarto Docs: Quick Tips For Better Docs
description:
Join us this leap year day to learn a few quick tips for leveling up your quarto (or Rmarkdown) docs.

In the modern workplace, there are always tradeoffs when writing a document on a deadline. However, there are a few tricks and tips that are game-changers in a quarto doc, transforming your static plot or table into an interactive beauty with a line or two of code.

In this interactive R tutorial, we will take a standard quarto doc from meh to amazing! You will learn a few tricks to add to your repertoire, and gain some hands-on practice that you can carry over to your next project.

**Details**

* Use this form to register: https://forms.gle/aYSGLP6N4C1vovFZ7
* **This event will be hosted over Zoom.** The link and passcode will be sent by email to those who registered in the form above on the day of the event.
* **This event will not be recorded**! It will be a live and collaborative tutorial.

**R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending): [https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct](https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct). For questions regarding accessibility, please email [nyc@rladies.org](mailto:nyc@rladies.org).**

title: RLadies February Meetup - Introduction to R and RStudio
description:
Join us on Tuesday, February 27th for an intro to R night!
Please note our location for this meetup has changed to:

Room 189
550 Rue Sherbrooke O
Montr√©al, QC H3A 1B9

**Agenda:**

* Settling in and and request for talks
* Speaker
* Networking / practical coding time

**Topic:**
In this session, we will first discuss how to get started in R language for new users and paths to careers in coding. We will then learn about the basics of R language and how to use RStudio integrated development environment (IDE). We will learn how to import and do basic manipulations of data sets, and how to then visualize these datasets in graphs using ggplot2 package. Feel free to bring your own datasets to test out! Toy datasets will also be provided through our Github page.

There will be pizza!!

**What to bring:**
Bring your laptop if you'd like to follow along with the examples. We recommend installing the latest version of [R](https://www.r-project.org/) and [RStudio](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/) before you arrive.

**Other:**
R-Ladies events always have been and will always be free to attend! RSVPs are not required, but do help us plan space requirements. We would like to thank the Quantitative Life Sciences department at McGill University for hosting this session!

**Questions?**
Please comment or message the organizers with any questions.

title: Shiny for Python
description: Shiny for Python is a powerful framework that combines interactivity with Python's vast resources for creating web applications. In this webinar, we will cover how to get started with it, its ui elements, server reactivity, plotting widgets and styling of your Shiny dashboards.

title: Data visualization (Part II)
description:
Join us for a 3-part workshop series meant to introduce you to R and RStudio. We will walk through the basics of how to handle data in R and how you can create data visualizations!

*Please note: There is one meetup link per workshop, please register for each workshop separately.*

1\. Introduction to R and RStudio
Date: January 25th, 2024 at 12:00-1:00pm

In this session, Reiko will go through R vocabulary; creating clear, organized scripts; using GitHub repositories for sharing scripts; creating a project; importing data; and troubleshooting.

2\. Data visualization \(Part I\)
Date: February 1st, 2024 at 12:00-1:00pm

In this session, Reiko will introduce R Markdown and the package ggplot2. You will see how to create the following data visualizations:

* histogram
* scatter plot
* line plot
* bar plot

**3\. Data visualization \(Part II\)**
**Date: February 22nd, 2024 at 12:00-1:00pm**

**In this session, Reiko will continue the topic of data visualizations. Using bar plots, you will see how to change colors and overall look and feel of a plot as well as exploring more plot types and how to save our masterpieces!**

title: Reports that write themselves: dynamic reporting with R Markdown
description:
Reporting your data and insights in writing, rather than just visually, is a common but often boring feature of data work. With R Markdown, you can create narrative reports that auto-update as you add new data, saving a lot of effort! During this workshop, you will be introduced to R Markdown with a focus on using it to create dynamically updating text reports. We will also dip our toes into conditional adjustments to the text using if-else loops.

Please bring a laptop with R and RStudio installed so that you can fully participate in the workshop. If you do not already have the package installed, you can install {rmarkdown} on your system by using install.packages(‚Äúrmarkdown‚Äù)in advance. The work will also use general {tidyverse} features, so having this package set installed is an advantage.

After the workshop, we will have ample time for networking and chatting over some snacks and drinks (courtesy of the Software Sustainability Institute).

Dr Eva Murzyn works as a statistician for the Scottish Government, setting up Reproducible Analytical Pipelines and automation of routine health data reporting. Previously, she has taught research and statistics during her career as a lecturer at University of Glasgow and University of Edinburgh.

title: Parameterized Reporting with Quarto
description:
**Abstract**

Tired of manually adjusting Quarto reports for different regions, time periods, or clients? Dreaming of using just one template to generate both interactive HTML and static Word/PDF versions of your reports?

Join our workshop to unlock the power of parameterized reporting with Quarto and leave with your own template and examples to modify for your own projects.

Get a sneak preview of what you‚Äôll learn by checking out the [materials](https://jadeyryan.com/talks/2023-09-25_posit_parameterized-quarto/) from my posit::conf(2023) talk.

We welcome everyone! However, if you‚Äôre new to Quarto or functional programming with {purrr}, take a look at the [pre-work](https://jadeyryan.quarto.pub/rladies-abuja-quarto-params/prework.html#sec-quarto-purrr) for some background videos/tutorials.

**Learning Objectives**

1. Understand what parameterized reporting is and when it is useful.
2. Learn how to convert a report into a parameterized template.
3. Render all variations of the report at once using [{quarto}](https://quarto-dev.github.io/quarto-r/) and [{purrr}](https://purrr.tidyverse.org/).
4. Generate multiple format outputs from the same template file with conditional content and conditional code execution.

**Is this workshop for me?**

If your answer to any of the following questions is ‚Äúyes‚Äù, then this is the right workshop for you.

* Do you frequently report the same set of metrics, tables, or graphs for different groups?
* Do you want to stop combing through your source code to find and replace your [hard-coded values](https://www.bloomtech.com/article/what-is-hard-coding) each time you need to create a new variation of your report?
* Do you want to make your life easier and your reports more reproducible by parameterizing your reports?

The workshop is designed for those with some experience in R and R Markdown or Quarto. It will be assumed that participants can perform basic data manipulation and visualization. Experience with the {tidyverse}, especially {purrr} and the pipe operator, is a major plus, but is not required.

**Workshop Materials**: [https://jadeyryan.quarto.pub/rladies-abuja-quarto-params/](https://jadeyryan.quarto.pub/rladies-abuja-quarto-params/)

title: [ONLINE] #tidytuesday Work Group
description:
Join fellow R-Ladies, including R-Ladies Chicago members, in exploring a #tidytuesday data set! For those craving human connection and some practice flexing your data science skills, this is the event for you! We will hold our event via Zoom, where you can meet other R-ladies, improve your R skills, and build your data science portfolio. This event is for people at all levels of R (beginner through advanced).

At this event, we'll revisit one of the Tidy Tuesday datasets from November 2023 on R-Ladies Global chapters data (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2023/2023-11-21).

**Agenda (all times in ET)**
6:30 - 6:45 pm Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm #tidytuesday
7:45 - 8:00 pm Discussion

**What is #tidytuesday?**
#TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project created by the R4DS online learning community that is focused on using tidyverse packages. A new data set and accompanying article featuring an interesting plot is released on Github every Monday. The goal is to generate a copy of the original plot or create your own original approach!

For more information on #tidytuesday, check out the official GitHub repository page ([https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday)).

**Who is this for?**
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world. This meetup will be co-hosted with R-Ladies Chicago.

**What should I bring?**
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

**Where will it take place?**
Please join us online via Zoom. A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend as guests and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Debugging in R
description:
Join [R-Ladies Rome](https://rladiesrome.quarto.pub/website/) for an empowering **Interactive Workshop**: **Debugging in R** exclusively designed for women in technology. In this workshop, we will dive deep into various topics including code troubleshooting tips, essential debugging functions (traceback(), browser(), debug(), trace(), and recover()), and gain insights into effective debugging strategies. Our expert speaker [Shannon Pileggi](https://www.linkedin.com/in/shannon-m-pileggi/) will share pivotal insights, best practices, and tips to degbug code in R.

Whether you are a beginner or an experienced professional, this event is the perfect opportunity for networking and learning from fellow women in the industry.

Join us on **February 20th at 6:15 PM CET** for an exciting and interactive session where you can expand your knowledge, connect with like-minded individuals, and explore the latest trends in web technology. This workshop is specifically curated to provide a conducive environment for **women in technology** to enhance their skills and discuss the challenges and opportunities they face in this male-dominated industry.

**Format**: This hands-on workshop will be hosted on Posit (RStudio) Cloud, a special RStudio instance accessible through your browser. Registered participants will receive details on accessing Posit Cloud closer to the event.
**Agenda**: We'll kick off with a warm welcome on Zoom, provide an opportunity to ensure everyone is set up to dive into the exciting world of debugging. Stay tuned for more updates!

Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to be a part of an inclusive community that empowers women in technology. Together, let's accelerate our growth and make a difference in the tech world!

title: Beautifying R Outputs: A Mentor/Mentee Event
description:
Bring your code and join us for a collaborative exploration to beautify your R outputs. Whether you're a mentee seeking guidance or a mentor eager to share your expertise, this event provides a platform to enhance your R skills! This will be a collaborative and inclusive environment where participants can learn, share, and grow together.

This event encourages mentorship and collaboration. Attendees are invited to bring their code and seek guidance from experienced individuals in packages related to data visualization and tables including **gt, ggplot, quarto, plotly, highcharter, officeverse, and shiny**. (Please be sure this code can be shared with others!)

If you're interested in volunteering as a mentor or have specific topics you'd like covered, please reach out to the organizers on Meetup.

After the event, join us for a casual social gathering at a local venue. Note that beverages are not covered by the event.

We look forward to seeing you there! Please come to the entrance of the main ARNOLD BUILDING.

If you are **not an R-Ladies member**, please RSVP in the useR event [https://www.meetup.com/seattle-user/](https://www.meetup.com/seattle-user/)

title: Reproducible pipelines book club #5
description:
The 5th meeting of our book club where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

During this meeting, Fulya G√∂kalp will show us how to re-organize a project using R Markdown, based on [chapter 9](https://raps-with-r.dev/project_rewrite.html). If you want to try it out, be sure to have RStudio with {rmarkdown} and {knitr} installed.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Python Rgonomics (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is excited to host a meetup on Tuesday February 20, 2024 from 3-4:30pm (entirely virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have a wonderful presentation from Emily Riederer, a Senior Analytics Manager at Capital One (https://emilyriederer.netlify.app/about). She will be giving a talk on "Python Rgonomics: Modern python tools that feel like R"!

For folks that cross languages from R to Python, come learn about newer tools in the Python space that mirror some of R's semantics and make users feel more at home, including:

* Setup like less painful installation (pyenv) and a great IDE (VSCode)
* Core computation: polars feels much more like dplyr than pandas
* The communication stack: seaborn's object interface explicitly inspired by ggplot2, Rich Iaonne's new gt python port
* Quarto notebooks

Think about it as opinionated data science stack that will feel more familiar to R users!

WHO is this for?

* If you are new to R, and want to come learn about some awesome Python packages and a great integrative developer environment (IDE)?
* If you are new to Python, and want to learn tools that feel like R?
* If you use RStudio, and want to learn about a new IDE?

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA

* 3:00‚Äì3:15pm Who we are \| Announcements \| What's next
* 3:15‚Äì4 pm Presentation: Python Rgnonomics
* 4‚Äì4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:

* The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?

A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:

* If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

email: bmore@rladies.org

twitter: @RLadiesBmore

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/

meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-baltimore/

title: Building a Chatbot with OpenAI, Shiny & R
description:
***R-Ladies Rome and TunisR User Group***
Unlock the potential of conversational AI in R!

**In order to attend the meetup, please fill out this short form**
**üëâ [http://tinyurl.com/4rsfzrn8](http://tinyurl.com/4rsfzrn8)**

Join our workshop as we guide you through querying the **OpenAI API** using the **{httr2}** package. Learn the ropes of developing a basic chatbot app using the OpenAI API and Shiny.

This interactive session empowers you to select a model (gpt-3.5-turbo or gpt-4), define a task/prompt for the model, input a message, and receive a dynamic response. Delve into the world of **GPT-powered chatbots** and witness the deployment of your own GPT chatbot app by the end of this engaging workshop.

Don't miss this opportunity to **blend R, Shiny, and OpenAI** for an exciting journey into the realm of conversational AI.

title: Workshop - Introduction to R
description:
Dear all,

The goal of our next meetup is for our attendees to become acquainted with R and R Studio in order to start their data analytics journey.

We'll cover:

* Brief intro to R as a programming language
* Functions, data structures, data types
* Reading data into R
* Basic data visualization in R
* R packages
* Examples and use cases

If time allows we will briefly introduce to you Rmarkdown and give a glimpse into how to make your analysis more reproducible.

We recommend you **bring your own laptop** where you have
R and RStudio installed (https://cran.r-project.org/ and https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/).
In case you want to install Rmarkdown you can follow the instructions at https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/installation.html

See you soon!

title: R-Ladies Darwin meet up
description:
Hi R-ladies community,

R-Ladies Darwin is excited to host a meetup on Wednesday Feb 14, 2024 from 11-12 (entirely virtual meetup on Zoom).

As a refresher, R-Ladies is a global organization with a mission to promote gender diversity within the R community. You can learn more about our mission and activities on our website: R-Ladies.
https://rladies.org/

This year, we will kick off with an event online, however, post-pandemic it would be great to move toward in-person meetings, so please let us know if you have any suggestions for suitable locations.

This meeting will be an opportunity to float potential topics for the year.
Some potential discussion points include:
\- Methods to visualise your data
\- Dealing with chunky processing\!
\- Workflows in machine learning
\- Overcoming entry barriers to R
\- Time series analysis

Any questions or suggestions, please feel free to get in touch.

title: R-Ladies Monthly Happy Hour
description:
Join R-Ladies Seattle for our monthly happy hour! Come and network with local R-Ladies to make new connections and discuss all things R. This is a casual event so you can stop by any time. You'll find us by our logo (and probably Kim's rainbow hair).

Chips and salsa provided!

Non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab.

title: ANU meet and greet for International Day of Women and Girls in Science
description:
February 11 is the [International Day of Women and Girls in Science](https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FInternational_Day_of_Women_and_Girls_in_Science&data=05%7C02%7Calice.richardson%40anu.edu.au%7C094e91010268497cb77008dc22953d80%7Ce37d725cab5c46249ae5f0533e486437%7C0%7C0%7C638423271581871573%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1dGzcgUEXPooJupYskO1z8cveDwJhEACbpBHn8c%2BPEs%3D&reserved=0). To celebrate this day, and the start of O-Week, ANU student and staff members of RLadies are invited to meet some of ANU's amazing women scientists, as well as staff from the College of Science and the College of Engineering, Computing & Cybernetics working on Gender Equity (GE), plus representatives of staff and student groups with a GE focus (including [Fifty50](https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffifty50.org.au%2F&data=05%7C02%7Calice.richardson%40anu.edu.au%7C094e91010268497cb77008dc22953d80%7Ce37d725cab5c46249ae5f0533e486437%7C0%7C0%7C638423271581878411%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JBwqqftW3uq%2Fdqy5PDhIJmcM42KNTdk4wfdFvABkq9Q%3D&reserved=0), Women\* in Physics, Astro and Engineering, [RLadies](https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Frladies.org%2F&data=05%7C02%7Calice.richardson%40anu.edu.au%7C094e91010268497cb77008dc22953d80%7Ce37d725cab5c46249ae5f0533e486437%7C0%7C0%7C638423271581884957%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=CMEBXCacfiD8%2B8Y%2FCBNCGwsDrLeEq%2F0X4KW%2FTViTDmI%3D&reserved=0), and [ANUSA Women's Department](https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fanusa.com.au%2Fadvocacy%2Fwomens-department%2F&data=05%7C02%7Calice.richardson%40anu.edu.au%7C094e91010268497cb77008dc22953d80%7Ce37d725cab5c46249ae5f0533e486437%7C0%7C0%7C638423271581891675%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ecqozjiKDE0sqb2rFuf3mrYSe%2Frcm1njL1IYv3lcZ4s%3D&reserved=0)).

There will be no PowerPoint and no speeches, just mingling and chatting with people who fundamentally think that the World will be much better once Science achieves Gender Equality.

Location: University Avenue lawns, in front of the Hanna Neumann building.

title: Reproducible pipelines book club #4
description:
Welcome to the fourth meeting of our book club, where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

In this meeting, Elen le Foll will explain how to keep your code well documented to improve reproducibility, based on [chapter 7](https://raps-with-r.dev/lit_prog.html).

This will be an online event, and you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions that might arise. We are all learning together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Reproducible book club #4
description:
Welcome to the third meeting in our book club where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

In this meeting, Elen le Foll will explain how to keep your code well documented to improve reproducibility, based on [chapter 7](https://raps-with-r.dev/lit_prog.html). If you want to try it out, be sure to have RStudio and {rmarkdown}, {knitr} installed.

Elen Le Foll is a post-doctoral researcher and lecturer in applied linguistics and language education at the University of Cologne with a strong interest in quantitative corpus linguistics methods. As a keen educator, she also enjoys teaching introductory courses in data management, critical data literacy, R, statistics, and data visualisation.

The meeting will not be recorded.

P.S. If you are in Bergen and want to meet to watch, let us know by sending a message to Julia or Jonelle, and we can arrange a meeting place.

title: Code & Tell
description:
Join us for the first 2024 Meetup of RLadies Sydney!

**Who**: R Ladies and friends
**What**: *Code & Tell*
**Where**: Nous Group, Level 34/60 Margaret St, Sydney NSW 2000 & on zoom
**When**: Wednesday February 7th, 6:00-7:00pm

Bring your R project, no matter how big or small, and showcase your code to fellow RLadies.

This collaborative meetup is the perfect place to seek help from others who might have faced similar challenges. Engage in discussions, exchange ideas, and collectively find solutions.

You will also have the chance to celebrate your victories, big or small! Share the successes you've achieved with your code and inspire others in the community. Any satisfying piece of code matters!

Light nibbles and a vibrant atmosphere are guaranteed, fostering an environment where collaboration and learning flourish.

Build a network of supportive individuals who share your passion for coding. You never know when a chance encounter might lead to a new collaboration or project.

RSVP now and let's code, share, and learn together.

We look forward to seeing you there!

title: CANCELLED: A ~Very Special~ R Function Show & Tell
description:
UPDATE 2024-02-04: Given the extreme weather that's rolling through Santa Barbara, we've decided to cancel this meetup. We hope you all can stay home, safe, and dry until this storm passes!

\-\-\-\-

Hi R-Ladies SB!

What do we all love more than a well-designed and helpful function?
Learning how to use that function with friends (and a minimal, easy-to-reproduce example), of course :)

Inspired in part by data science artwork (see Allison Horst‚Äôs [amazing portfolio](https://allisonhorst.com/r-packages-functions) as an example) and in part by our own attempts at coming up with creative ways to remember new tools, we invite you to join us for an R function show-and-tell! This event will be held in person at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS) on Monday, February 5th, from 5:30 to 7 pm.

**What to expect:**

* Attendees should arrive with a favorite function(s) in mind
* We‚Äôll facilitate some mixing and mingling so that folks with similar interests might find one another to collaborate with.
* We‚Äôll provide paper and pens for sketching out your function. Got artists in your group? Feel free to get creative with it! Not so confident in your drawing skills? No problem. Some hand-written annotations and arrows can get the job done.
* Everyone will hang their functions on the wall, gallery-style, for others to explore and learn from. We may take turns saying a few words about our function, why it‚Äôs so rad, and how others might use it.

**ADDITIONALLY:** This is a special edition R-Ladies SB meetup, which was planned to intentionally coincide with when some R-Ladies from other chapters are in town (a huge thanks to [Beatriz Milz](https://beamilz.com/about), from R-Ladies S√£o Paulo, who reached out and inspired this meetup). We are so excited to meet and network with others from our global community, and we hope you all are too :)

See you there!
Sam, Camila, Danielle

***Banner art by Allison Horst. Alt Text:*** *‚Äújanitor::clean_names(): convert all column names to \*_case!‚Äù Below, a cartoon beaver putting shapes with long, messy column names (pulled from a bin labeled ‚ÄúMESS‚Äù and ‚Äúnot so awesome column names‚Äù) into a contraption that converts them to lower snake case. The output has stylized text reading ‚ÄúWay more deal-withable column names.‚Äù Learn more about clean_names and other awesome data cleaning tools in [janitor](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/janitor/vignettes/janitor.html).*

title: Data visualization (Part I)
description:
Join us for a 3-part workshop series meant to introduce you to R and RStudio. We will walk through the basics of how to handle data in R and how you can create data visualizations!

*Please note: There is one meetup link per workshop, please register for each workshop separately.*

1\. Introduction to R and RStudio
Date: January 25th, 2024 at 12:00-1:00pm

In this session, Reiko will go through R vocabulary; creating clear, organized scripts; using GitHub repositories for sharing scripts; creating a project; importing data; and troubleshooting.

**Date: February 1st, 2024 at 12:00-1:00pm**

* **scatter plot**

* **bar plot**

In this session, Reiko will continue the topic of data visualizations. Using bar plots, you will see how to change colors and overall look and feel of a plot as well as exploring more plot types and how to save our masterpieces!

title: RLadies January Meetup - Introduction to Python in RStudio
description:
Join us on Tuesday, January 30th for our first meetup of 2024!
Please note our location for this meetup has changed to:

Room 189
550 Rue Sherbrooke O
Montr√©al, QC H3A 1B9

**Agenda:**

* Settling in and and request for talks
* Speaker
* Networking / practical coding time

**Topic:**
In this session, we will first go over the basics of the Python Programming Language. Next, we will learn to use Python modules for efficient data wrangling and visualization. And finally, we will cover the different methods to implement Python code into RStudio.

**What to bring:**
Bring your laptop if you'd like to follow along with the examples. We recommend installing the latest version of [R](https://www.r-project.org/) and [RStudio](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/) before you arrive. Installation of [Python](https://www.python.org/downloads/) is highly recommended for practicing Python code during this session's tutorial.

**Other:**
R-Ladies events always have been and will always be free to attend! RSVPs are not required, but do help us plan space requirements. We would like to thank the Quantitative Life Sciences department at McGill University for hosting this session!

**Questions?**
Please comment or message the organizers with any questions.

description:
It's the New Year! A great time to catch up with old friends and make some new ones as in the R-Ladies Chicago community!

title: From Zero Lines to Endless Code:  Non-Coder to Coder Transformation
description:
**Who is this for?**

Anyone who has the tiniest interest in a programming language. Especially those who fear taking the first step to write a simple line of code.

**Prerequisites**

Prior knowledge of R programming is not required. This will be a non-technical session to motivate young individuals who are interested in a career related to Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science and Data Analytics.

**Type:**
This is a free online event. The Zoom link will be provided to registered participants via Meetup 10 minutes before the scheduled meeting time."

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Using LLMs to develop R code (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is excited to host a meetup on Tuesday January 23, 2024 from 4-5:30pm (entirely virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have a wonderful presentation from Kathleen Morrill, a Senior Computational Scientist at Colossal Biosciences. She will be giving a talk on "Writing your code with R-ubber duckies that talk back: using LLMs to develop R code"!

WHO is this for?

* If you are new to R and want to learn about R packages?
* If you know R, but want to expand your knowledge about large language models (LLMs)?

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA

* 4:00‚Äì4:15pm Who we are \| Announcements \| What's next
* 4:15‚Äì5 pm Presentation: Writing your code with R-ubber duckies that talk back: using LLMs to develop R code
* 5‚Äì5:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:

* The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?

A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:

* If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

title: Parameterized reporting using Quarto
description:
Tired of manually adjusting Quarto reports for different regions, time periods, or clients? Dreaming of using just one template to generate both interactive HTML and static Word/PDF versions of your reports?

Join our workshop to unlock the power of parameterized reporting with Quarto and leave with your own template and examples to modify for your own projects.

Get a sneak preview of what you'll learn by checking out the [slides](https://jadeyryan.com/talks/2023-09-25_posit_parameterized-quarto/) for my posit::conf(2023) talk.

Everyone is welcome to attend. If you're new to Quarto, we recommend watching [Tom Mock's excellent 2-hour introduction to Quarto](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yvi5uXQMvu4).

title: Flipping Tables: Creating Tables with {gt} in R
description:
Data visualization is a fundamental tool in any data science tool kit. Graphs and plots are often synonymous with data visualization, though are not the only means of presenting or visualizing data. In this workshop we will be exploring the often-overlooked side of data visualization: tables. Join us at R Ladies Edinburgh to \*flip the table\* on data visualization and learn how to create stunning, customizable tables in R using the {gt} package. During the workshop, you will be introduced to {gt} and the philosophy behind the package, gain insights into what it can do as well as have the opportunity to experiment and create your own tables.

Please bring a laptop with R and RStudio installed so that you can fully participate in the workshop. If you do not already have the package installed, you can install {gt} on your system by using \`install.packages(‚Äúgt‚Äù)\` ahead of the workshop.

After the workshop, we will have ample time for networking and chatting over some snacks and drinks (courtesy of the Software Sustainability Institute).

*Dr Brittany Blankinship is a Lecturer in Data Science at the University of Edinburgh as part of the Data-Driven Innovation initiative in Health and Social Care at the Usher Institute. She is passionate about many things including tackling the stigma around learning/teaching statistics and coding (it can be fun!), data visualization and data storytelling, and most importantly R.*

title: Join our team! R-Ladies NYC Board Information Session
description:
If you ever wanted to be more involved with your local R-Ladies New York chapter, now is the time! We are looking for new members to join us as event organizers on the R-Ladies NYC Board.

This information session will be a meet and greet with current board members: we‚Äôll introduce ourselves, explain responsibilities and the expected time commitment of a board member. The application for new board members is now available (due Wednesday, January 31st): [https://forms.gle/VCGJFZsDdBd3bJjQ9](https://forms.gle/VCGJFZsDdBd3bJjQ9)

We are happy to take questions as well as suggestions for future meetups, so please feel free to attend with feedback even if you may not be interested in joining the board as an organizer.

If you are interested in joining the board but are unable to attend this meeting, please connect with us via Slack (sign up to join our Slack using this form: [https://forms.gle/FZ7MUwBZ7p2YWnuG6](https://forms.gle/FZ7MUwBZ7p2YWnuG6)) or email us at nyc@rladies.org with your questions, thoughts, and comments. We‚Äôll be happy to follow up with more information!

***

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be emailed to attendees on the day of the event. We will request your email address upon registration to ensure you receive the Zoom passcode.

***

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending): [https://rladies.org/coc/](https://rladies.org/coc/)

title: Introduction to Reproducible Publications with Quarto
description:
We are so excited to announce our next virtual meetup, which will serve as an introduction to reproducible publications with Quarto (https://quarto.org/). We are happy to collaborate with R-Ladies Rome (https://www.meetup.com/rladies-rome/) to organize this meetup. ü•≥

Join us for an exciting workshop with Torin White on January 16 at 6 pm CET.

In 2024, many exciting opportunities await you, featuring a diverse array of meetups dedicated to enhancing your skills within our community. **‚ú®**

**Description:**

Quarto is a new open-source scientific and technical publishing system that Posit developed, extending the capabilities of its predecessor R Markdown. It is a powerful tool that may be used in both RStudio and Jupyter Notebooks for combining narrative text with code for reports, academic articles, books, web pages, and more. This workshop is a short version of the carpentry-style ‚ÄúIntroduction to Reproducible Publications with RStudio‚Äù including lecture and demos alternating with hands-on exercises, so by the end of the workshop, attendees will have ‚Äúauthored‚Äù a reproducible paper of their own with the data and narrative provided. Specifically, we will cover an introduction to Quarto documents, writing and styling narrative text, and integrating R code in one seamless, publication-ready document. For the best experience, it is suggested that attendees have a basic understanding of the RStudio environment before attending the workshop.

If you are up for joining us, please register for the workshop here üîó [https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZYucOmhqzguH9b5MAW51nKgx-9mAvmMKVLn](https://us06web.zoom.us/meeting/register/tZYucOmhqzguH9b5MAW51nKgx-9mAvmMKVLn)

We are very much looking forward to seeing many of you!

title: Estad√≠stica f√°cil con R y dplyr
description:
¬°Les damos la bienvenida!

En esta reuni√≥n aprenderemos a realizar pruebas estad√≠sticas f√°ciles y r√°pidas. Para ello utilizaremos el poder de manipulaci√≥n de datos de dplyr sumado a las funciones del paquete rstatix. Adem√°s acompa√±aremos nuestro an√°lisis con gr√°ficas generadas de forma simple con el paquete ggpubr.

**TEMARIO**
Repaso de las funciones select, filter y group_by de dplyr
Obtenci√≥n de estad√≠sticas de resumen
Flujos de an√°lisis para las pruebas t y ANOVA
Comprobaci√≥n de los supuestos de la prueba
Aplicaci√≥n de las pruebas
Graficaci√≥n de resultados
An√°lisis para datos no param√©tricos: Pruebas de Wilcoxon y Kruskal-Wallis

**FECHA**
Jueves 11 de enero de 2024, 5 p.m. (CDMX)

**DESCARGA LOS MATERIALES EN:**
https://github.com/RLadiesCuerna/meetup_enero_2024

**CONOCIMIENTOS PREVIOS REQUERIDOS**
Para aprovechar al m√°ximo esta reuni√≥n es importante que est√©s familiarizada con los conceptos de promedio, mediana, cuartiles, desviaci√≥n est√°ndar y distribuci√≥n normal. Adem√°s es importante que comprendas los tipos de objetos y la sintaxis m√°s b√°sica del lenguaje de programaci√≥n R. Por otra parte, ser√≠a muy provechoso para ti estudiar c√≥mo es que dplyr simplifica la sintaxis de R usando pipes y verbos.

**REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE**
R >=4.0 y RStudio
Paquetes de R: ggpubr, tidyverse y rstatix, los cuades puedes instalar con la instrucci√≥n:
install.packages(c("ggpubr", "rstatix", "tidyverse"), dependencies = TRUE)

title: Reproducible pipelines book club #3
description:
Welcome to the third meeting of our book club, where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

In this meeting, Gabe Winter (R-Ladies Cologne) will explain how to write functions in R, based on [chapter 6](https://raps-with-r.dev/fprog.html).

This will be an online event, and you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions that might arise. We are all learning together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

title: Reproducible book club #3
description:
Welcome to the third meeting in our book club where we are going through the chapters of [‚ÄúBuilding reproducible analytical pipelines with R‚Äù](https://raps-with-r.dev/) by Bruno Rodrigues.

During this meeting, Gabe Winter from R-Ladies Cologne will explain how to write functions in R, based on [chapter 6](https://raps-with-r.dev/fprog.html). This will be an online event where you are welcome to code along and discuss any questions or problems that might arise. We are all learning this together!

The meeting will not be recorded.

P.S. If you are in Bergen and want to meet to watch, let us know by sending a message to Julia or Jonelle, and we can arrange a meeting place.

title: New Year's SOCIAL
description:
We know - things have been terribly quiet on the R-Ladies front! That's about to change!
Please join us for a (very informal) social to chat about our R-Ladies chapter: let's reconnect and brainstorm about Meetup topics.

In an effort to make this event as inclusive as possible (i.e. family- and kid-friendly), we will meet at Boxcar, which is at Depot Park. Plenty of space for little ones to run around, plus a playground, and food options (Goldie's Burgers, Humble Wood Fire Pizza, and the Pop-A-Top General Store).

Bring all your positive vibes and great ideas: we look forward to seeing everyone again and starting off 2024 strong!

title: R-Ladies Monthly Happy Hour
description:
Join R-Ladies Seattle for our monthly happy hour! Come and network with local R-Ladies to make new connections and discuss all things R. This is a casual event so you can stop by any time. You'll find us by our logo (and probably Kim's rainbow hair).

Chips and salsa provided!

Non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages available. Attendees are responsible for their own tab.
